sen.j: 現在線に沿って線路を増設、複々線とする。
sen.e: New railways should be laid along the existing railways, making the railways a four-track line.
New railways should be laid along the existing railways, making the railways a four-track line.
New railways should be laid along the existing railways, making the railways a four-track line.

sen.j: 別ルートで狭軌新線を建設する。
sen.e: New narrow gauge railways should be laid through a new route.
New narrow gauge railways should be laid through a new route.
New narrow gauge railways should be laid through a new route.

sen.j: 別ルートで広軌新線を建設する。
sen.e: New broad gauge railways should be laid through a new route.
New broad gauge railways should be laid through a new route.
New broad gauge railways should be laid through a new route.

sen.j: 東海道の線増計画は、従来の常道であれば複々線案が採られたところであった。
sen.e: For increasing the number of tracks of the Tokaido line, it would be a traditional common sense to adopt the four-track line.
For increasing the number of tracks of the Tokaido line, it would be traditional common sense to adopt the four-track line.
For increasing the number of tracks of the Tokaido line, it would be traditional common sense to adopt the four-track line.

sen.j: しかし、十河ら国鉄幹部は将来の発展性を視野に入れ、あえて困難の多い広軌新線建設を決定したのである。
sen.e: However, with future expansibility in sight, the executives of JNR, including SOGO, decided to lay new broad gauge railways that were supposed to include many difficult problems.
However, with future expandability in sight, the executives of JNR, including SOGO, decided to lay new broad gauge railways that were supposed to include many difficult problems.
However, with future expandability in sight, the executives of JNR, including Sogo, decided to lay new broad gauge railways that were supposed to include many difficult problems.

sen.j: それは戦前の弾丸列車計画を、戦後の技術革新の下で、改めて実現しようとする超高速列車計画であった。
sen.e: It was a super-high speed train plan in innovative technologies in the post-war era, to realize the bullet train plan in the pre-war era.
It was a super-high speed train plan with innovative technologies in the post-war era, to realize the bullet train plan in the pre-war era.
It was a super-high speed train plan with innovative technologies in the post-war era, to realize the bullet train plan in the pre-war era.

sen.j: 同年5月25日には鉄道技術研究所（現：鉄道総合技術研究所）が、広軌新線ならば東京 - 大阪間の3時間運転は技術的に可能であるという報告を創立50周年記念講演会で述べた。
sen.e: On May 25, the same year, the railway technology research laboratory (present Railway Technical Research Institute) reported in the lecture meeting commemorating the 50th anniversary of the laboratory that, when new broad gauge railways were laid, it would be possible to operate trains on them in three hours between Tokyo and Osaka.

On May 25, the same year, the railway technology research laboratory (present Railway Technical Research Institute) reported in the lecture meeting commemorating the 50th anniversary of the laboratory that, when new broad gauge railways were laid, it would be possible to operate trains on them in three hours between Tokyo and Osaka.

On May 25, the same year, the railway technology research laboratory (present Railway Technical Research Institute) reported in the lecture meeting commemorating the 50th anniversary of the laboratory that, when new broad gauge railways were laid, it would be possible to operate trains on them in three hours between Tokyo and Osaka.

sen.j: 十河はその話を聞くや強い関心を示し、国鉄幹部を集めて技術研究所員に詳細を話させたという。
sen.e: As soon as hearing the report, SOGO showed a keen interest in it, gathered the executives of JNR and had the research officer concerned at the laboratory talked its details.
As soon as hearing the report, SOGO showed a keen interest in it, gathered the executives of JNR and had the research officer concerned at the laboratory talk about its details.
As soon as hearing the report, Sogo showed a keen interest in it, gathered the executives of JNR and had the research officer concerned at the laboratory talk about its details.

sen.j: 当時欧米では、将来の大量輸送手段として航空機と高速道路網による高速輸送が有望視され、鉄道はそれらに取って代わられる時代遅れのものだという見解が広まっていた。
sen.e: In Europe and the United States, for volume transportation measures, high-speed transportation using airplanes and road networks was considered promising, and the opinion was gaining support that railways would be replaced with such new networks and would be old-fashioned.

In Europe and the United States, for volume transportation measures, high-speed transportation using airplanes and road networks was considered promising, and the opinion was gaining support that railways would be replaced with such new networks and would be old-fashioned.

In Europe and the United States, for volume transportation measures, high-speed transportation using airplanes and road networks was considered promising, and the opinion was gaining support that railways would be replaced with such new networks and would be old-fashioned.

sen.j: 日本でもこれを範としようとする向きが一般的であり、在来線とは別規格の高速新線を建設するという計画は、国鉄内部でさえも疑問視する者が多かった。
sen.e: Even in Japan, the general trend was to follow this opinion, and even many persons within JNR questioned the plan to lay a high-speed railway line in specifications different from those of existing regular lines.

Even in Japan, the general trend was to follow this opinion, and even many persons within JNR questioned the plan to lay a high-speed railway line in specifications different from those of existing regular lines.

Even in Japan, the general trend was to follow this opinion, and even many persons within JNR questioned the plan to lay a high-speed railway line in specifications different from those of existing regular lines.

sen.j: 鉄道ファンでもある作家の阿川弘之ですら、大和 (戦艦)（大和型戦艦）・万里の長城・ピラミッドが「世界三大一覧構造物・建設物」であり、この時期に莫大な投資をして新幹線を造れば「第2の戦艦大和」となって世界の物笑いの種になると批判した（後に阿川は新幹線が世界の鉄道斜陽論を覆すに至るまでの成功を収めたのを見て、十河の後を継いで国鉄総裁を務めた石田礼助との対談において、自らの不明を悔やむ発言をしている）。
sen.e: Even Hiroyuki AGAWA, a railway fan, criticized the plan saying that the battleship Yamato, the Great Wall of China and pyramids constituted "the list of the three items in the world: structures," and if Shinkansen were built investing a vast amount of money at this era, it would become the second battleship Yamato and would be laughed in the world (later, seeing that Shinkansen became so successful to overturn the railway-declining opinion in the world, AGAWA expressed his regret in a talk with Reisuke ISHIDA who succeeded the post of president of JNR from SOGO).

Even Hiroyuki AGAWA, a railway fan, criticized the plan saying that the battleship Yamato, the Great Wall of China and pyramids constituted "the three big structures of the world," and if Shinkansen were built investing a vast amount of money in this era, it would become the second battleship Yamato and would be laughed at by the world (later, seeing that Shinkansen became so successful as to overturn the railway-declining opinion of the world, AGAWA expressed his regret in a talk with Reisuke ISHIDA who succeeded the post of president of JNR from SOGO).

Even Hiroyuki AGAWA, a railway fan, criticized the plan saying that the battleship Yamato, the Great Wall of China and pyramids constituted 'the three big structures of the world,' and if Shinkansen were built investing a vast amount of money in this era, it would become the second battleship Yamato and would be laughed at by the world (later, seeing that Shinkansen became so successful as to overturn the railway-declining opinion of the world, AGAWA expressed his regret in a talk with Reisuke ISHIDA who succeeded the post of president of JNR from Sogo).

sen.j: そのような厳しい状況下で、十河と島は東海道に新たな大規模高速輸送用の鉄道路線（新幹線）を実現すべく政治的活動（十河が担当）と、技術的プロジェクト（島らが担当）を続けた。
sen.e: Under such a serious situation, SOGO and SHIMA continued carrying out political activities (by SOGO) and technical projects (by SHIMA) to lay railways (Shinkansen) for high-speed transportation newly along Tokaido.

Under such a serious situation, SOGO and SHIMA continued carrying out political activities (by SOGO) and technical projects (by SHIMA) to lay railways (Shinkansen) for new high-speed transportation along the Tokaido.

Under such a serious situation, Sogo and Shima continued carrying out political activities (by Sogo) and technical projects (by Shima) to lay railways (Shinkansen) for new high-speed transportation along the Tokaido.

sen.j: 技術的裏付けの下、1958年に建設計画が承認され、翌1959年4月20日に起工式が行われた。
sen.e: Backed up technically, the construction plan was approved in 1958 and the ground-breaking ceremony was held on April 20, 1959
Backed up technically, the construction plan was approved in 1958 and the ground-breaking ceremony was held on April 20, 1959.
Backed up technically, the construction plan was approved in 1958 and the ground-breaking ceremony was held on April 20, 1959.

sen.j: 総工費は当初予定から修正され、3,800億円にまで膨らんだ。
sen.e: The total construction cost was revised from the initial one, increasing up to \380 billion
The total construction cost was revised, increasing up to \380 billion from the original plan.
The total construction cost was revised, increasing up to \380 billion from the original plan.

sen.j: 元々十河などが国会 (日本)内での承認を得るために安く見積もっていたこと、さらには新幹線建設に集中するために地方路線建設の請願を蹴っていた事で国会議員の不興を買っていた事もあっった。
sen.e: Originally, SOGO and persons concerned estimated the cost less than the actually needed one to get approval of the Diet (of Japan), and in addition, rejected requests for constructing local railway lines to concentrate their efforts to the construction of Shinkansen, incurring displeasure of members of the Diet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Originally, SOGO and persons concerned low-balled the estimated cost needed to get approval of the Diet (of Japan), and in addition, rejected requests for constructing local railway lines to concentrate their efforts on the construction of Shinkansen, incurring displeasure of members of the Diet.

Originally, Sogo and persons concerned low-balled the estimated cost needed to get approval of the Diet (of Japan), and in addition, rejected requests for constructing local railway lines to concentrate their efforts on the construction of Shinkansen, incurring displeasure of members of the Diet.

sen.j: そのため、後には国会で責任問題に発展した。
sen.e: Therefore, the cost problem became a liability issue later.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the cost problem became a liability issue later.

sen.j: 新幹線開業前に責任を取る形で十河は国鉄総裁を退任し、島も国鉄を退職する事になる。
sen.e: So as to take the responsibility, SOGO resigned president of JNR and SHMA retired from JNR as well.
So as to take responsibility, SOGO resigned as president of JNR and SHIMA retired from JNR as well.
So as to take responsibility, Sogo resigned as president of JNR and Shima retired from JNR as well.

sen.j: 1961年5月1日に国鉄はこのプロジェクトに対し、世界銀行から8,000万アメリカ合衆国ドル（当時は1ドル360円の固定相場制）の融資を受けたが、1964年までに完成させるという厳しい条件が付けられた（この融資は1981年に返済が完了した）。
sen.e: On May 1, 1961, JNR obtained a loan of US$80 million (at a fixed rate of US$1 = \360 at that time) to this project from World Bank, with the severe condition that the project should be completed by 1964 (this loan was completely redeemed in 1981).

On May 1, 1961, JNR obtained a loan of US$80 million (at a fixed rate of US$1 = \360 at the time) for this project from the World Bank, with the severe condition that the project should be completed by 1964 (this loan was completely payed back in 1981).

On May 1, 1961, JNR obtained a loan of US$80 million (at a fixed rate of US$1 = \360 at the time) for this project from the World Bank, with the severe condition that the project should be completed by 1964 (this loan was completely paid back in 1981).

sen.j: この融資を受けたことで、新幹線プロジェクトは国内事情によって中断することは許されなくなった。
sen.e: With this loan obtained, it became not to be allowed to stop this Shinkansen project due to domestic reasons.
With this loan, it became impossible to stop the Shinkansen project due to domestic reasons.
With this loan, it became impossible to stop the Shinkansen project due to domestic reasons.

sen.j: その建設に関しては前述の通り、戦前の「弾丸列車計画」の際に開削されたトンネルや、買収された用地の多くが活用された。
sen.e: Concerning the construction of the railways, many of the tunnels having been excavated for the "Bullet train plan" and many of the land spaces having been purchased at the time were used effectively, as described above.

sen.j: 5年という短期間で完成したのは、この時の用地買収及び工事があったからだともいわれている。
sen.e: It is also said that the project was able to be completed in a short period of five years, due to the existence of the land spaces having been procured at that time and works having been already done also at that time.

It is also said that the project was able to be completed in a short period of five years, due to the existence of the land having been procured at that time and works having been already done also at that time.

sen.j: また大阪府・京都府内では、完成した新幹線の線路を高架工事中の仮線として用いて、暫定的に阪急京都本線の電車を走らせていたこともあった（→東海道新幹線新幹線の線路を先に走った阪急電車）。
sen.e: In Osaka Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture, completed Shinkansen railways were used temporarily for operating trains on the Hankyu Kyoto main line for which the work to construct elevated railways was under way (-> Hankyu Railway whose trains ran on the Tokaido Shinkansen line).

sen.j: 1962年には神奈川県小田原市近郊に鴨宮モデル線区（小田急線高座渋谷駅付近 - 東海道線鴨宮付近）が完成した。

sen.j: 直線・カーブ・トンネル・鉄橋と、線形や地上設備のシチュエーションが一通り揃っており、データ収集が容易である。

sen.e: Around Kamonomiya, the section was placed adjacent to the Tokaido main line, making it convenient to bring in necessary train-cars and materials.

sen.j: 鉄道技術研究所からも近く、問題が発生した時も対処が容易である。

sen.e: In the Japanese pavilion in the New York World's fair held in New York, the United States, from April 22 prior to the operation start, a mock-up of the train was exhibited, showing Japan's high technological level.

sen.j: 開業当初の営業最高速度は200km/h（東京 - 新大阪間「ひかり」4時間、「こだま」5時間）。
sen.e: When the operation started, the trains were operated at the maximum speed of 200 km/s (with the operation of the "Hikai" and that of the "Kodama trains taking four and five hours, respectively, between Tokyo and Shin-Osaka).

sen.j: 路盤の安定を待って翌年に210km/h運転（同「ひかり」3時間10分、「こだま」4時間）を開始した（→1965年10月1日・11月1日国鉄ダイヤ改正も参照）。
sen.e: Waiting for that the railway bed state was stabilized, operations at 210 km/h were started in the next year (three hours and ten minutes for "Hikari" and four hours for "Kodama" between Tokyo and Shin-Osaka) (-> refer also to the revision of JNR train schedule on Oct. 1, 1965).

sen.j: 日本の二大都市である東京 - 大阪間は、1958年から在来線の特急で日帰り可能になっていたものの滞在時間がわずか2時間余りしか取れなかった。
sen.e: Between Tokyo and Osaka, two big cities in Japan, making a day trip became possible from 1958 using limited express on the regular railway line, but the time allowed to stay at the trip destination was limited to only two hours.

sen.j: しかし新幹線の開通により、日帰りでも滞在時間を充分取れるようになり、社会構造に著しい変化を及ぼした。
sen.e: However, when the Shinkansen line started its operation, it became possible to stay for enough time at a trip destination, changing the social structure drastically.

sen.j: ビジネスやレジャーの新しい需要を喚起し、東海道新幹線においては当初の12両編成が、1970年の日本万国博覧会の開幕を機に16両編成まで拡大され、高速大量輸送機関としての確固たる地位を確立した。
sen.e: With demands for business and leisure being generated, the initial 12-train-car organization of the Tokaido Shinkansen line was expanded to a 16-train-car organization at the opportunity when the Japan World Exposition '70 started in 1970, establishing a firm position as a high-speed and volume transportation system.

sen.j: その一方で、新幹線の建設や特急・急行列車の増発、さらには都市部における通勤輸送増強（通勤五方面作戦など）などの設備投資に追われた。
sen.e: On the other hand, JNR was forced to continue making investment in various facilities, such as for constructing Shinkansen, for increasing the number of limited express trains and express trains and furthermore, for increasing the commuter-transporting capacities (for example, the five-direction strategy)

sen.j: このから、新幹線の開業した1964年度から国鉄収支は赤字に転落し、以後それは拡大する一方となって、結果的に新幹線建設は国鉄破綻の1つの原因となったと言われる。
sen.e: Therefore, JNR's balance fell into the red from 1964 when the Shinkansen line started its operation, and the deficit amount continued increasing after that, and it is said that, resultantly, the construction of the Shinkansen line was one cause of the bankruptcy of JNR.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, JNR's balance fell into the red from 1964 when the Shinkansen line started its operation, and the deficit amount continued increasing after that, and it is said that, as a result, the construction of the Shinkansen line was one the causes of the bankruptcy of JNR.

Therefore, JNR's balance fell into the red from 1964 when the Shinkansen line started its operation, and the deficit amount continued increasing after that, and it is said that, as a result, the construction of the Shinkansen line was one the causes of the bankruptcy of JNR.

sen.j: これに対し、東海旅客鉄道の葛西敬之会長は著書の中で「東海道新幹線はあくまで内部留保された資金と借金で建設資金をまかない、それらを運賃・料金収入のみですべて回収したものであり、新幹線建設が国鉄破綻の引き金を引いたという認識は誤りだ」と指摘している。
sen.e: For this, Yoshiyuki KASAI, chairman of Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central) refuted in a book he wrote that "The Shinkansen line was constructed with only internally reserved money and borrowed money, and the cost has been recovered only by the train fares and other charges, and therefore, it is wrong to say that the construction of Shinkansen triggered the bankruptcy of JNR."

sen.j: いずれにせよ、以後の国鉄において、新幹線は重要な収入源ともなっていく。
sen.e: Anyhow, in JNR thereafter, Shinkansen became an important revenue source.

sen.j: その後、東海道新幹線に続いて、同じように需要の増加していた山陽本線の抜本的輸送力改善と高速化を目的として、1967年に東海道新幹線を延伸する形で山陽新幹線が着工された。
sen.e: After that, following the Tokaido Shinkansen line, the work to construct the Sanyo slinkiness line was started in 1967 in the form of extending the Tokaido Shinkansen line, to drastically increase transportation capacity of the Sanyo main line, transportation demands for which had also increased, as well as to increase the transportation speed on the line.

sen.e: However, the construction of the Tohoku and Jostsu Shinkansen lines met protest campaigns against it, difficulties in procuring necessary land and also met an abnormal amount of water flow in tunnel excavation work.

sen.j: このため、前者2つの新幹線は予定より工事が5年も遅れ、成田新幹線に至っては工事中止となってしまった（ただし、後に東日本旅客鉄道と京成電鉄の成田空港乗り入れの際にこの新幹線建設で作られた設備が生かされることになる）。
sen.e: Therefore, the completion of the former two Shinkansen lines was delayed by five years from the plan, and the work to construct the Narita slinkiness line was stopped (however, the facilities constructed for this Sinkansen line were used later when JR East and Keisei Electric Railway Co., Ltd.. built a railway line to access the Narita airport).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: また、新幹線沿線での騒音・振動による公害問題がこの頃深刻化した（名古屋新幹線公害など）。
sen.e: Environmental pollution problems due to noise and vibration along Shinkansen lines became serious around this time (for example, the environmental pollution caused by Shinkansen trains in Nagoya).

sen.j: さらに国鉄財政の悪化に伴う運賃・料金値上げの繰り返し、労働紛争によるストライキの頻発化などから、既存新幹線の乗客が減少傾向に陥った。
sen.e: In addition, due to repeated fare hikes corresponding to the deterioration of JNR's finance and the frequent occurrences of strikes because of labor troubles, the number of passengers on existing Shinkansen lines tended to decline.

In addition, due to repeated fare hikes corresponding to the deterioration of JNR's finance and the frequent occurrences of strikes because of labor troubles, the number of passengers on existing Shinkansen lines tended to decline.

sen.j: そして経営問題と労働紛争の影響から技術革新も見られなくなり、新幹線の発展・発達は一時停滞した。
sen.e: Then affected by the business operation problems and labor troubles, no technical innovation became to be achieved, and the progress and advancement of Shinkansen became stagnant for a while.
Then affected by the business operation problems and labor troubles, no technical innovation was achieved, and the progress and advancement of Shinkansen became stagnant for a while.
Then affected by the business operation problems and labor troubles, no technical innovation was achieved, and the progress and advancement of Shinkansen became stagnant for a while.

sen.j: 1982年に大宮発着という暫定的な形で東北新幹線と上越新幹線は開業し（→1982年11月15日国鉄ダイヤ改正・新幹線リレー号も参照）、1985年には用地買収の関係で遅れていた都心（上野）乗り入れを果たした（→1985年3月14日国鉄ダイヤ改正も参照）。
sen.e: In 1982, the Tohoku Shinkansen line and the Joetsu Shinkansen line started their operations, with Omiya used as the departure and arrival place (-> refer also to the revision of JNR train schedule on Nov. 15, 1982 and the new Shinkansen relay train), and in 1985, the operations of those lines were at last extended to the central Tokyo area (Ueno) (-> refer also to the revision of JNR train schedule on March 14, 1985).

sen.j: これにより東北・上越地方における鉄道シェアは大幅に拡大した。
sen.e: After this, the railway share of the traffic in the Tohoku and Joetsu regions increased considerably.
After this, the railway share of the traffic in the Tohoku and Joetsu regions increased considerably.

sen.j: だが、国鉄財政はそれら新幹線の建設費負担も重なって遂に破局的状態となり、中曽根康弘内閣の下で断行された1987年の国鉄分割民営化に至るのである。
sen.e: However, with the burden of the construction of these Shinkansen lines added as well, the finance of JNR reached a catastrophic situation, leading to the division and privatization of JNR in 1987 by Yasuhiro NAKASONE Cabinet.

tit.j: JR発足から現在までの流れ
tit.e: Shinkansen in the era from the inauguration of JR to today
Shinkansen in the era from the inauguration of JR to today
Shinkansen in the era from the inauguration of JR to today

sen.j: 国鉄の分割・民営化後、東北・上越新幹線は東日本旅客鉄道、東海道新幹線は東海旅客鉄道、山陽新幹線は西日本旅客鉄道の運営とされた。
sen.e: In the division and privatization of JNR, it was decided that the Tohoku and Joetsu Shinkansen lines should be operated by JR East, the Tokaido Shinkansen line by JR Tokai, and the Sanyo Shinkansen line by JR West.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the division and privatization of JNR, it was decided that the Tohoku and Joetsu Shinkansen lines should be operated by JR East, the Tokaido Shinkansen line by JR Tokai, and the Sanyo Shinkansen line by JR West.

In the division and privatization of JNR, it was decided that the Tohoku and Joetsu Shinkansen lines should be operated by JR East, the Tokaido Shinkansen line by JR Tokai, and the Sanyo Shinkansen line by JR West.

sen.j: しかしながら、当初設備は第3種鉄道事業者の「新幹線保有機構」が保有し、各会社が第2種鉄道事業者として路線を借り受けて運営する形とした。
sen.e: However, initially, the facilities were owned by Shinkansen Holding Corporation, a third class railway enterprise, and each JR company operated the corresponding line or lines borrowing the railways as a second class railway operator.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, initially, the facilities were owned by the Shinkansen Holding Corporation, a third class railway enterprise, and each JR company operated the corresponding line or lines borrowing the railways as a second class railway operator.

However, initially, the facilities were owned by the Shinkansen Holding Corporation, a third class railway enterprise, and each JR company operated the corresponding line or lines borrowing the railways as a second class railway operator.

sen.j: 新幹線の保守費用は各社が負担し、新幹線保有機構は設備の貸し代だけを受け取るものであった。
sen.e: Maintenance cost of Shinkansen lines were shouldered by each JR company, and Shinkansen Holding Corporation collected only the fees of lending the facilities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Maintenance cost of Shinkansen lines were shouldered by each JR company, and the Shinkansen Holding Corporation collected only the fees of lending the facilities.
Maintenance cost of Shinkansen lines were shouldered by each JR company, and the Shinkansen Holding Corporation collected only the fees of lending the facilities.

sen.j: その目的は、利益の出る新幹線事業によって赤字となる他地域JR会社への補填を行うことであった。
sen.e: The objective of this scheme was to compensate the red finance of the JR companies in other regions with profit from Shinkansen operations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The objective of this scheme was to compensate the red finance of the JR companies in other regions with profit from Shinkansen operations.
The objective of this scheme was to compensate the red finance of the JR companies in other regions with profit from Shinkansen operations.

sen.j: しかし、前記JR3社の経営が安定化して、東京証券取引所などへの株式公開が視野に入ると、輸送量に応じて貸し賃が変わるこの制度のままでは会社の営業努力が反映されないことや、各社の資産・債務の額が確定できないことなどが問題視されるようになった。
sen.e: However, when the business operations of the three JR companies described above became stabilized and selling their shares in Tokyo Stock Exchange and others came into sight, the following problems became to be raised: With the lending fees being paid corresponding to the amount of traffic, the business operation efforts of each company could not be reflected in its business performance, and the amounts of assets and liabilities could not be fixed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, when the business operations of the three JR companies described above became stabilized and listed their shares on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and others came into sight, the following problems arose: With the lending fees being paid corresponding to the amount of traffic, the business operation efforts of each company could not be reflected in its business performance, and the amounts of assets and liabilities could not be fixed.

However, when the business operations of the three JR companies described above became stabilized and listed their shares on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and others came into sight, the following problems arose: With the lending fees being paid corresponding to the amount of traffic, the business operation efforts of each company could not be reflected in its business performance, and the amounts of assets and liabilities could not be fixed.

sen.j: 結局1991年に制度を変更し、各鉄道会社が新幹線資産を新幹線保有機構を改編した鉄道整備基金から60年賦で買い取ることにした。
sen.e: Then in 1991 at last, the system was changed so that each of the railway companies should buy up the facilities in 60 year annual installments from Railway Development Fund, which was reorganized from Shinkansen Holding Corporation

sen.e: Then in 1991, at last, the system was changed so that each of the railway companies should buy up the facilities in 60 annual installments from the Railway Development Fund, which was reorganized from the Shinkansen Holding Corporation.

Then in 1991, at last, the system was changed so that each of the railway companies should buy up the facilities in 60 annual installments from the Railway Development Fund, which was reorganized from the Shinkansen Holding Corporation.

sen.j: 分割・民営化後、技術・営業面で停滞していた新幹線も新型車両の登場、新形態など積極的な流れが見られるようになった。
sen.e: Shinkansen-related activities had been stagnant both in the technical aspect and in the business aspect for a while, but, after the privatization and separation of JNR, active activities, such as introduction of new train-cars and new railway system styles became to be seen.

Shinkansen-related activities had been stagnant both in the technical aspect and in the business aspect for a while, but, after the privatization and separation of JNR, active activities, such as introduction of new train-cars and new railway system styles came to be seen.

Shinkansen-related activities had been stagnant both in the technical aspect and in the business aspect for a while, but, after the privatization and separation of JNR, active activities, such as introduction of new train-cars and new railway system styles came to be seen.

sen.j: 後者の代表として、JR東日本は新幹線規格（フル規格）の線路を新規に建設することなく、既存の在来線を改良し、専用の車両を新造したうえで、新幹線と在来線が直通運転できるようにしたミニ新幹線を整備した。
sen.e: As a typical example, JR East introduced mini-Shinkansen lines in the following way, without constructing new railways meeting Shinkansen specifications (full specifications): Existing regular railways were modified, new train-cars dedicated for the railways were manufactured newly and these trains were enabled to be operated through both a Shinkansen line and a regular railway line.

As a typical example, JR East introduced mini-Shinkansen lines in the following way, without constructing new railways meeting Shinkansen specifications (full specifications): Existing regular railways were modified, new train-cars dedicated for the railways were manufactured and these trains were enabled for operation through both Shinkansen lines and regular railway lines.

As a typical example, JR East introduced mini-Shinkansen lines in the following way, without constructing new railways meeting Shinkansen specifications (full specifications): Existing regular railways were modified, new train-cars dedicated for the railways were manufactured and these trains were enabled for operation through both Shinkansen lines and regular railway lines.

sen.j: 1992年に新幹線400系電車を新造し、山形新幹線として奥羽本線の福島駅 (福島県) - 山形駅が、1997年に新幹線E3系電車を新造し、秋田新幹線として田沢湖線・奥羽本線の盛岡駅 - 秋田駅が、1999年に新幹線E3系電車1000番台を増備し、山形新幹線の延伸として奥羽本線の山形駅 - 新庄駅が、それぞれ順次営業運転を開始した。
sen.e: In 1992, 400 series Shinkansen train-cars were manufactured newly and the Yamagata Shinkansen line started its operation between the Fukushima station (located in Fukushima Prefecture) and the Yamagata station; In 1997, E3 series Shinkansen train-cars were manufactured newly and the Akita Shinkansen line started its operation between the Morioka station and the Akita station on the Tazawako line and the Ou main line; in 1999, E3 series 1000 - 1999 Shinkansen train-cars were manufactured additionally and the section between the Yamagata station and the Shinjo station of the Ou main line started its operation as an extension of the Yamagata Shinkansen.

In 1992, 400 series Shinkansen train-cars were manufactured and the Yamagata Shinkansen line started operation between Fukushima station (located in Fukushima Prefecture) and Yamagata station; In 1997, E3 series Shinkansen train-cars were manufactured and the Akita Shinkansen line started operation between Morioka station and Akita station on the Tazawako line and the Ou main line; in 1999, E3 series 1000 - 1999 Shinkansen train-cars were manufactured additionally and the section between Yamagata station and Shinjo station of the Ou main line started operation as an extension of the Yamagata Shinkansen.

sen.cmt: 訳漏れ補足しました。用語統一

sen.j: JR西日本は山陽新幹線博多総合車両所への車庫線を旅客線化し、1990年に博多南線として博多駅 - 博多南駅を、こだま号に使用される車両を用いる在来線特急という形態で営業運転を開始した。
sen.e: JR West made the railway section to the comprehensive railway yard for Sanyo Shinkansen used for passenger train-cars as well, and started the operation of the Hakata-Minami line between the Hakata station and the Hakata-Minami station using trains-cars for Kodama trains and as limited-express trains on regular railway lines.
sen.cmt: 山陽新幹線博多総合車両所への車両基地を旅客線化し： ウェブでの表現”山陽新幹線博多総合車両所への車庫線を旅客線化し”に変更してあります。
sen.e: JR West made the railway section to the comprehensive railway yard for Sanyo Shinkansen used for passenger train-cars as well, and started operation of the Hakata-Minami line between Hakata station and Hakata-Minami station using trains-cars for Kodama trains and as limited-express trains on regular railway lines.

JR West made the railway section to the comprehensive railway yard for Sanyo Shinkansen used for passenger train-cars as well, and started operation of the Hakata-Minami line between Hakata Station and Hakata-Minami Station in 1990 using trains-cars for Kodama trains and as limited-express trains on regular railway lines.

sen.j: また最高速度は210km/hの時代が長く続いた。
sen.e: The maximum speed of Shinkansen remained 210 km/h for a long time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The maximum speed of Shinkansen remained at 210 km/h for a long time.
The maximum speed of Shinkansen remained at 210 km/h for a long time.

sen.j: しかしながら、国鉄末期頃（→1985年3月14日国鉄ダイヤ改正・1986年11月1日国鉄ダイヤ改正も参照）から次第に向上されるようになり、2008年現在では東海道新幹線で270km/h、東北新幹線区間で275km/h、山陽新幹線区間で300km/hに至っている。
sen.e: However, from towards the end of the JNR era (-> refer also to the revision of JNR train schedule on March 14, 1985 and also to the revision of JNR train schedule on Nov. 1, 1986), the speed became to be increased gradually, and now, the maximum train speeds reached 270 km/h in the Tokaido Shinkansen line, 275 km/h in the Tohoku Shinkansen line and 300 km/h in the Sanyo Shinkansen line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, from towards the end of the JNR era (-> refer also to the revision of the JNR train schedule on March 14, 1985 and also to the revision of the JNR train schedule on Nov. 1, 1986), the speed was increased gradually, and now, the maximum train speeds have reached 270 km/h on the Tokaido Shinkansen line, 275 km/h on the Tohoku Shinkansen line and 300 km/h on the Sanyo Shinkansen line.

However, from towards the end of the JNR era (-> refer also to the revision of the JNR train schedule on March 14, 1985 and also to the revision of the JNR train schedule on November 1, 1986), the speed was increased gradually, and now in 2008, the maximum train speeds have reached 270 km/h on the Tokaido Shinkansen line, 275 km/h on the Tohoku Shinkansen line and 300 km/h on the Sanyo Shinkansen line.

sen.j: また時速アップ以外にも、停車駅での停車時間の短縮や、停車駅間の速度を出来るだけ高速度で維持するなどして、僅かな分単位ながら主要駅間の時間短縮を図る工夫もされている。
sen.e: In addition to increases in the train speed, to further reduce the traveling time between major stations, efforts have also been made for shortening the stopping periods at stations and for maintaining high speeds between stations as long as possible, although the amount of time reduced with these measures is a level to be counted in minutes.

In addition to increases in the train speed, to further reduce the traveling time between major stations, efforts have also been made for shortening the stopping periods at stations and for maintaining high speeds between stations as long as possible, although the amount of time reduced with these measures is at a level counted in minutes.

sen.j: 国鉄末期に建設が凍結されていた整備新幹線は工事が再開され、東北新幹線（盛岡 - 八戸・2002年）・北陸新幹線（長野新幹線・1997年）・九州新幹線（新八代 - 鹿児島中央・2004年）が部分開業した。
sen.e: The work to construct the projected Shinkansen lines, which had remained stopped, were restarted, and the Tohoku Shinkansen line (between Morioka and Hachinohe in 2002), the Hokuriku Shinkansen line (as the Nagano Shinkansen line in 1997) and the Kyushu Shinkansen line (between Shin-Yatsushiro and Kagoshima-Chuo in 2004) started their partial operations, respectively.

sen.j: 残った区間や未開業の北海道新幹線なども工事が次第に進みつつある。
sen.e: For the remaining sections and the Hokkaido Shinkansen line, the work has been progressing steadily as well.

sen.j: また20世紀末以降、新幹線による通勤・通学が増加しつつある。
sen.e: Since around the end of the 20th century, use of Shinkansen for commuting to offices or schools has increased.
Since around the end of the 20th century, use of Shinkansen for commuting to offices or schools has increased.
Since around the end of the 20th century, use of Shinkansen for commuting to offices or schools has increased.

sen.j: これは、いわゆるバブル景気以降の大都市における地価の高騰で、新幹線で通勤・通学が可能な郊外（主に東京への通勤・通学を目的に栃木県、群馬県、静岡県東部が多い）の住宅に住む人が増えたためである。
sen.e: This is because, in and after the bubble economy era, the land price in large cities rose steeply, and many became to live in the suburbs from where they could commute to their offices or schools if using Shinkansen (mostly in Tochigi Prefecture, Gunma Prefecture and the east part of Shizuoka Prefecture for commuting to offices or schools in Tokyo).

This is because, in and after the bubble economy era, the price of land in large cities rose steeply, and many came to live in the suburbs from where they could commute to their offices or schools if using Shinkansen (mostly in Tochigi Prefecture, Gunma Prefecture and the east part of Shizuoka Prefecture for commuting to offices or schools in Tokyo).

This is because, in and after the bubble economy era, the price of land in large cities rose steeply, and many came to live in the suburbs from where they could commute to their offices or schools if using Shinkansen (mostly in Tochigi Prefecture, Gunma Prefecture and the east part of Shizuoka Prefecture for commuting to offices or schools in Tokyo).

sen.j: 1983年2月の新幹線定期乗車券販売開始をきっかけに、新幹線通勤定期券を支給する企業の増加、さらに企業が支給する通勤定期券代の所得税非課税限度額の引き上げがそれに輪をかけた。
sen.e: Starting with selling commuter passes for Shinkansen, the number of companies offering commuter passes for Shinkansen increased, and in addition, the limit of nontaxable income for commuter passes given by companies was raised, accelerating this trend.

Starting with selling commuter passes for Shinkansen in February 1983, the number of companies offering commuter passes for Shinkansen increased, and in addition, the limit of nontaxable income for commuter passes given by companies was raised, accelerating this trend.

sen.j: 朝・夕の新幹線においては通勤客で混雑が激しくなり、通勤客向けのダイヤも設定されるようになった。
sen.e: Shinkansen trains in the morning and in the evening became congested with commuters, and train schedules for commuters became provided.
Shinkansen trains in the morning and in the evening became congested with commuters, and train schedules for commuters became provided.

sen.j: これに対応してJR東日本ではMax (鉄道車両)という多座席型の2階建車両を投入し、1列車あたりの定員を大幅に増やした。
sen.e: As a measure for this situation, JR East introduced two-level train-cars, which were called Max and were provided with lots of seats, increasing the number of passenger seats per train-car drastically.

As a measure for this situation, JR East introduced two-level train-cars, which were called Max and were provided with lots of seats, increasing the number of passenger seats per train-car drastically.

As a measure for this situation, JR East introduced two-level train-cars, which were called Max and were provided with lots of seats, increasing the number of passenger seats per train-car drastically.

sen.j: 1964年10月1日に最初の新幹線である東海道新幹線が開業して以来、40年以上に亘って新幹線に乗車していた乗客の（新幹線に起因する）死亡事故は発生していない。
sen.e: During 40 years since the Tokaido Shinkansen line, the first Shinkansen line, started its operation, no fatal passenger accident (due to Shinkansen) has occurred on Shinkansen.
During the 40 years since the Tokaido Shinkansen line, the first Shinkansen line, started operation, no fatal passenger accident (due to the Shinkansen) has occurred on the Shinkansen.

During the 40 years since the Tokaido Shinkansen line, the first Shinkansen line, started operation on October 1, 1964, no fatal passenger accident (due to the Shinkansen) has occurred on the Shinkansen.

sen.j: 投身自殺による死亡例は多数発生しており、またドアに乗客の手を挟んで引き摺り死亡させたケース（1995年、三島駅乗客転落事故を参照）はあった。
sen.e: Many killing-oneself accidents by jumping on railway tracks occurred, and a person was caught by a train-car door, dragged and killed (refer to the passenger-falling-down accident at the Mishima station in 1995).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many suicides by jumping on railway tracks occurred, and a person was caught by a train-car door, dragged and killed (refer to the passenger-falling-down accident at Mishima station in 1995).
Many suicides by jumping on railway tracks occurred, and a person was caught by a train-car door, dragged and killed (refer to the passenger-falling-down accident at Mishima Station in 1995).

sen.j: しかしながら、これらは新幹線システムそのものの根本的欠陥に起因する事故ではないため例外と考えられた。
sen.e: However, these were not caused by fundamental defects of the Shinkansen system itself, and are considered exceptions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, these were not caused by fundamental defects of the Shinkansen system itself, and are considered exceptions.
However, these were not caused by fundamental defects of the Shinkansen system itself, and are considered exceptions.

sen.j: そのため、新幹線の安全性は概して非常に高いものと捉えられている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is recognized that the safety of Shinkansen is generally quite high.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is recognized that the safety of Shinkansen is generally quite high.
Therefore, it is recognized that the safety of Shinkansen is generally quite high.

sen.j: 新幹線の安全を確保するシステムが的確に運用され、恒常的に維持されてきている。
sen.e: The system to secure the safety of Shinkansen has been operated securely and has been maintained regularly.
The system to secure the safety of Shinkansen has been operated securely and has been maintained regularly.
The system to secure the safety of Shinkansen has been operated securely and has been maintained regularly.

sen.j: このことは、日本の鉄道技術の水準を端的に示す要素であるとも言える。
sen.e: It could be said that this fact plainly shows a high level of railway-related technologies in Japan.
It could be said that this fact plainly shows a high level of railway-related technologies in Japan.
It could be said that this fact plainly shows a high level of railway-related technologies in Japan.

sen.j: この事実は新幹線の安全神話などと称される。
sen.e: This fact is sometimes called safety myth of Shinkansen.
This fact is sometimes called the safety myth of the Shinkansen.
This fact is sometimes called the safety myth of the Shinkansen.

sen.j: しかし死者こそ生じなかったものの、重大な事故に至る一歩手前の事態は過去に何度か発生している。
sen.e: However, although no fatal accident ha occurred, a few accidents that might have led to serious ones occurred in the past.
However, although no fatal accident have occurred, a few accidents that might have led to serious ones occurred in the past.
However, although no fatal accident have occurred, a few accidents that might have led to serious ones occurred in the past.

tit.j: 新幹線における事故の事例
tit.e: Examples of accidents on the Shinkansen
Examples of accidents on the Shinkansen

sen.j: 1973年に東海道新幹線の大阪運転所（鳥飼基地）からの回送列車が脱線した事故、1991年9月30日のひかり291号（100系X編成）が、車輪が固着したまま三島駅までATC頭打ち速度（225km/h）で走行した事例、そして1999年に山陽新幹線福岡トンネルで通過中の列車に福岡トンネルコンクリート塊落下事故等は、安全確保に悪影響を及ぼす事例と考えられ、重大視された。
sen.e: In 1973, a deadhead from the Osaka operation station (Torigai railway yard) was derailed; On September 30, 1991, the Hikari 290 train ran up to the Mishima station with the wheels fixed (or not rotated), at the speed of 225 km/h, the maximum of the speeds for which ATC was enabled; In 1991, a lump of concrete dropped on a train passing through the Fukuoka tunnel of the Sanyo Shinkansen line; All of these were considered serious examples badly affecting the safety.
sen.cmt: 大阪運転所（鳥飼基地）からの東海道新幹線大阪運転所脱線事故： ウェブでの表現 ”大阪運転所（鳥飼基地）からの回送列車が脱線した事故、1991年9月30日のひかり291号（100系X編成）が、車輪が固着したまま三島駅までATC頭打ち速度（225km/h）で走行した事例"に変更してあります。
sen.e: In 1973, a deadhead from the Osaka operation station (Torigai railway yard) was derailed; On September 30, 1991, the Hikari 290 train ran up to Mishima station with the wheels locked (or not rolling), at the speed of 225 km/h, the maximum speed for which ATC was enabled; In 1991, a lump of concrete dropped on a train passing through the Fukuoka tunnel of the Sanyo Shinkansen line; All of these were considered serious examples badly affecting safety.

In 1973, a deadhead from the Osaka operation station (Torigai railway yard) was derailed; On September 30, 1991, the Hikari 291 train (100 series Shinkansen electric train-cars, a x train-car organization) ran up to Mishima Station with the wheels locked (or not rolling), at the speed of 225 km/h, the maximum speed for which ATC was enabled; In 1991, a lump of concrete dropped on a train passing through the Fukuoka tunnel of the Sanyo Shinkansen line in 1999; All of these were considered serious examples badly affecting safety.
sen.cmt: 数字修正年号補足訳漏れ補足

sen.j: 特に1990年代末期からトンネルのコンクリート剥落事故が多発した。
sen.e: In particular, many concrete-falling accidents inside tunnels occurred from towards the end of 1990s.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In particular, many falling concrete accidents inside tunnels occurred starting towards the end of the 1990s.
In particular, many falling concrete accidents inside tunnels occurred starting towards the end of the 1990s.

sen.j: これらの事故は、山陽新幹線が建設された昭和40年代以降、高度成長期の建設ブームのもと、促成による手抜き施工が新幹線工事でも随所で行われていたことを露呈させた。
sen.e: These accidents exposed the fact that, in the construction boom in the high-growth period in the middle of the 1960s and later, hastily and sloppily done work existed in various portions of the Shinkansen lines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These accidents exposed the fact that, in the construction boom in the high-growth period in the middle of the 1960s and later, hasty and sloppy work existed in various portions of the Shinkansen lines.

These accidents exposed the fact that, in the construction boom in the high-growth period in the middle of the 1960s and later when the Sanyo Shinkansen was built, hasty and sloppy work existed in various portions of the Shinkansen lines.

sen.j: そのため、JR各社は設備保全の徹底した対策を求められている。
sen.e: Therefore, each JR company was requested to take thorough measures for maintaining the facilities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, each JR company was requested to take thorough measures for maintaining the facilities.
Therefore, each JR company was requested to take thorough measures for maintaining the facilities.

sen.j: また在来線と直通運転する山形新幹線では、つばさ (列車)号と自動車との踏切事故がしばしば発生している。
sen.e: In the Yamagata Shinkansen line where through operation with the regular railway line has been introduced, accidents at railway-crossings between a Tsubasa train and a car have occurred frequently.
On the Yamagata Shinkansen line where through operation with the regular railway line has been introduced, accidents at railway-crossings between Tsubasa trains and cars have occurred frequently.
On the Yamagata Shinkansen line where through operation with the regular railway line has been introduced, accidents at railway-crossings between Tsubasa trains and cars have occurred frequently.

sen.j: この様なケースは新幹線の事故というよりは、在来線での日常的事故の範疇に属するものである。
sen.e: These cases would be included in the category of daily accidents on regular railway lines rather than those on Shinkansen lines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These cases would be included in the category of daily accidents on regular railway lines rather than those on Shinkansen lines.
These cases would be included in the category of daily accidents on regular railway lines rather than those on Shinkansen lines.

sen.j: しかしながら、新幹線の在来線直通における高速運転の課題として常に想起される事例でもある。
sen.e: However, they are also the cases that are always brought to mind as a problem related to high-speed through operation of Shinkansen train-cars on regular railway lines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, they are also the cases that are always brought to mind as a problem related to high-speed through operation of Shinkansen train-cars on regular railway lines.

tit.j: 大井川河口を震源とする地震の事例
tit.e: Earthquake cases at the estuary of the Oigawa River
Earthquake cases at the estuary of the Oigawa River
Earthquake cases at the estuary of the Oigawa River

sen.j: 東海道新幹線が開業してから約半年が経過した1965年4月20日、静岡県の大井川河口を震源とするマグニチュード6.1の地震が発生し、静岡市周辺の盛り土が崩れた。
sen.e: On April 20, 1965, in approx. six months after the Tokaido Shinkansen line started its operation, an earthquake of magnitude 6.1 occurred centered on the estuary of the Oigawa River, Shizuoka Prefecture, destroying railway mounds there.

On April 20, 1965, approx. six months after the Tokaido Shinkansen line started operation, an earthquake of magnitude 6.1 occurred, centered on the estuary of the Oigawa River, Shizuoka Prefecture, destroying railway mounds there.

sen.j: 発生直後に全ての列車の運行を停止し、運転本数が少なかったこともあり（1時間に片道2本）大きな被害は出なかった。
sen.e: Immediately after it occurred, all trains on the line were stopped, and no serious damage was incurred, also because the number of trains operated was small (two trains an hour in one direction).
Immediately after it occurred, all trains on the line were stopped, and no serious damage was incurred, also because the number of trains operated was small (two trains an hour in one direction).

sen.j: しかし、当時の運行責任者であった斎藤雅男（元国鉄新幹線運転車両部長、鉄道工学の専門家）次のように言っている。、

sen.j: 「当時は雨の影響で地盤が弱くなっており、大きく陥没していたところもあった。」

sen.j: なお、山陽新幹線の一部区間と東北新幹線以後の新幹線にはスラブ軌道が採用されている。
sen.e: By the way, slab tracks are used in some sections of the Sanyo Shinkansen line and in the Tohoku Shinkansen line and later-constructed Shinkansen lines.

tit.j: 阪神・淡路大震災の事例
tit.e: Cases in the Great Hanshin-Awaji earthquake
Cases in the Great Hanshin-Awaji earthquake
Cases in the Great Hanshin-Awaji earthquake

sen.j: 1990年代以降、日本国内における大きな地震災害の多発により、高速鉄道の地震に対する脆弱性が指摘される様になった。
sen.e: In 1990s and later, many big earthquakes occurred in Japan, and vulnerability of high-speed railway lines to earthquakes became pointed out.
In the 1990s and later, many big earthquakes occurred in Japan, and vulnerability of high-speed railway lines to earthquakes was pointed out.
In the 1990s and later, many big earthquakes occurred in Japan, and vulnerability of high-speed railway lines to earthquakes was pointed out.

sen.j: 1995年1月17日の阪神・淡路大震災では、被災地域において山陽新幹線の高架橋が破損・一部落下し、新大阪 - 姫路間が80日間に亘り不通となった。
sen.e: In the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake that occurred on January 17, 1995, elevated bridges of the Sanyo Shinkansen line in the earthquake-stricken areas were damaged, with some portions of them fallen down, stopping the operation between the Shin-Osaka station and the Himeji station over 80 days.

In the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake that occurred on January 17, 1995, elevated bridges of the Sanyo Shinkansen line in the earthquake-stricken areas were damaged, with some portions of them faling down, stopping operation between Shin-Osaka station and Himeji station for over 80 days.

In the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake that occurred on January 17, 1995, elevated bridges of the Sanyo Shinkansen line in the earthquake-stricken areas were damaged, with some portions of them falling down, stopping operation between Shin-Osaka Station and Himeji Station for over 80 days.

sen.j: 地震発生は午前5時46分で、この日の営業運転が始まる前であったため、惨事には至らずに済んだ。
sen.e: The occurrence of the earthquake early in the morning, at 5: 46 before the train operation of the day started, saved serious accidents due to train operation from occurring.
The occurrence of the earthquake early in the morning, at 5:46 before the train operation of the day started, saved serious accidents due to train operation from occurring.

sen.j: これを機に高架橋の補強などの耐震対策が進められた。
sen.e: Based on this experience, earthquake-resistant measures, such as reinforcement of elevated bridges, have been taken
Based on this experience, earthquake-resistant measures, such as reinforcement of elevated bridges, have been taken.

tit.j: 新潟県中越地震の事例
tit.e: Cases in the Niigata Chuetsu earthquake
Cases in the Niigata Chuetsu earthquake
Cases in the Niigata Chuetsu earthquake

sen.j: さらに、2004年10月23日の新潟県中越地震においては、上越新幹線が甚大な被害を受けた。
sen.e: Furthermore, in the Niigata Chuetsu earthquake on Oct. 23, 2004, serious damage was inflicted on the Joetsu Shinkansen line.
Furthermore, in the Niigata Chuetsu earthquake on Oct. 23, 2004, serious damage was inflicted on the Joetsu Shinkansen line.
Furthermore, in the Niigata Chuetsu earthquake on Oct. 23, 2004, serious damage was inflicted on the Joetsu Shinkansen line.

sen.j: 高架やトンネルなどの構造物に損傷が発生したほか、上越新幹線列車の「とき (列車)325号」（10両編成、新幹線200系電車K25編成）が長岡駅の手前付近を約200km/hで走行中に脱線した。
sen.e: In addition to that damage was inflicted on structures, such as elevated railways and tunnels, the Toki 325 train on the Joetsu Shinkansen line (a ten train-car organization, the K25 organization of 200 series Shinkansen train-cars) was derailed while running at a speed of approx. 200 km/h immediately before reaching the Nagaoka station.

In addition to the damage that was inflicted on structures, such as elevated railways and tunnels, the Toki 325 train on the Joetsu Shinkansen line (a ten train-car organization, the K25 organization of 200 series Shinkansen train-cars) was derailed while running at a speed of approx. 200 km/h immediately before reaching Nagaoka station.

In addition to the damage that was inflicted on structures, such as elevated railways and tunnels, the Toki 325 train on the Joetsu Shinkansen line (a ten train-car organization, the K25 organization of 200 series Shinkansen train-cars) was derailed while running at a speed of approx. 200 km/h immediately before reaching Nagaoka Station.

sen.j: これはまた新幹線史上初の営業運転中の脱線事故となった。
sen.e: This was the first derailed accident in operation in the Shinkansen history.
This was the first derailment accident during operation in Shinkansen history.
This was the first derailment accident during operation in Shinkansen history.

sen.j: 上越新幹線には地震感知システム「ユレダス」をカスタマイズした「コンパクトユレダス」が採用されていた。
sen.e: In the Joetsu Shinkansen line, Compact UrEDAS, which was a customized version of Urgent Earthquake Detection and Alarm System "UrEDAS," was employed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the Joetsu Shinkansen line, Compact UrEDAS, which was a customized version of the Urgent Earthquake Detection and Alarm System "UrEDAS," was employed.
On the Joetsu Shinkansen line, Compact UrEDAS, which was a customized version of the Urgent Earthquake Detection and Alarm System 'UrEDAS,' was employed.

sen.j: しかし、「とき325号」のケースでは通過地点でほぼ直下型の地震であったため、初期微動（地震波）検知後にブレーキをかけたものの地震の被害を受ける前に停車する事はできなかった。
sen.e: However, in the "Toki 325 train" case, the train could not stop before having been damaged, although the brake was applied immediately after a preliminary tremor (an earthquake wave) was detected, because the earthquake occurred just under the train.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in the "Toki 325 train" case, the train could not stop before having been damaged, although the brake was applied immediately after a preliminary tremor (an earthquake wave) was detected, because the earthquake occurred just under the train.

However, in the 'Toki 325 train' case, the train could not stop before having been damaged, although the brake was applied immediately after a preliminary tremor (an earthquake wave) was detected, because the earthquake occurred just under the train.

sen.j: この200km/h走行時の脱線の衝撃で、レールの多くは道床の締定が外れ、一部のレールはねじ曲がるなどの大きな被害を受けた。
sen.e: Due to shocks of the derailment at the speed of 200 km/h, the rails were damaged seriously, for example, most of them disconnected from the track beds, and some were bent.
sen.cmt: 締定： 意味が理解できませんでした。”接続”の意味に解して訳してあります。 なお、ウェブには、ここから、数行の記述はありません。
sen.e: Due to shocks of the derailment at a speed of 200 km/h, the rails were damaged seriously, for example, most of them disconnected from the track beds, and some were bent.
Due to shocks of the derailment at a speed of 200 km/h, the rails were damaged seriously, for example, most of them disconnected from the track beds, and some were bent.

sen.j: 通常、列車がこの規模の地震に震源地付近で直撃された場合、例え停車していても脱線は免れ得ないと考えられる。
sen.e: Ordinarily, when a train is struck by an earthquake of this magnitude at a place near to the earthquake center, it is considered impossible to escape from being derailed even if the train has stopped.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ordinarily, when a train is struck by an earthquake of this magnitude at a place close to the earthquake center, it is considered impossible to escape from being derailed even if the train has stopped.

sen.j: しかしながら、この事例では脱線したとはいえ編成全体の横転などには至らず、死者・重傷者などは奇跡的に生じなかった。
sen.e: In this case, however, although having been derailed, the train escaped from being overturned as a whole and no fatal nor serious physical damage was inflicted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this case, however, although having been derailed, the train escaped from being overturned as a whole and no fatal nor serious physical damage was inflicted.

sen.j: とき325号の事例では、対向列車の不在が幸いした。
sen.e: In the case of the Toki 325 train, it was lucky that no train was running on the track on the other side.
In the case of the Toki 325 train, it was lucky that no train was running on the track on the other side.
In the case of the Toki 325 train, it was lucky that no train was running on the track on the other side.

sen.j: 地震発生5分後に対向列車とすれ違うダイヤになっていたこともあった。
sen.e: The Toki train and another train on the track on the other side were scheduled to pass the same place running in opposite directions with each other, in five minutes after the earthquake occurred.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Toki train and another train on the track on the other side were scheduled to pass the same place running in opposite directions with each other five minutes after the earthquake occurred.

sen.j: 対向車と正面衝突していれば重大な事故を起こしたことは想像に難くない。
sen.e: It is easily imaginable that, if these two trains collided head-on, a serious accident would have been caused.

sen.e: It is easy to imagine that, if these two trains collided head-on, a serious accident would have been caused.

sen.j: また、事故現場は積雪の多い地帯のためレール脇に雪を融かして流すための溝があり、そこに車体の一部が填まり込むことで横転せずに済んでいた。
sen.e: In addition, because the place where the accident occurred was an area where lots of snow was supposed to fall, a ditch to melt snow was provided beside the railways, and part of the train-car bodies were caught into the ditch, escaping from being overturned.

In addition, because the place where the accident occurred was an area where lots of snow was supposed to fall, a ditch to melt snow was provided beside the railways, and part of the train-car bodies were caught in the ditch, escaping being overturned.

In addition, because the place where the accident occurred was an area where lots of snow was supposed to fall, a ditch to melt snow was provided beside the railways, and part of the train-car bodies were caught in the ditch, escaping being overturned.

sen.j: 一般にはレール脇は平坦であるため、もしそのような場所で脱線していれば車体は完全に横転していたかもしれない。
sen.e: Ordinarily, a flat area is provided on either side of the railways, and if a train was derailed in such an area, the train-cars might have been overturned completely.

sen.j: この事故は新幹線を運営するJR各社に、新幹線における地震対策の重要性を強く認識させる事になった。
sen.e: This accident made each Shinkansen line-operating JR company recognize the importance of taking anti-earthquake measures in Shinkansen lines.

tit.j: 災害・テロへの対策不足
tit.e: Insufficiency of measures against disaster and terrorism
Insufficiency of measures against disaster and terrorism
Insufficiency of measures against disaster and terrorism

sen.j: 新幹線では、航空機や船舶と異なり、通常の運行では乗客名簿などは整備されない。
sen.e: Contrary to airplanes and ships, no passenger list is available in Shinkansen.
Contrary to airplanes and ships, no passenger list is available for Shinkansen.
Contrary to airplanes and ships, no passenger list is available for Shinkansen.

sen.j: 万一、転覆事故などで多数の死傷者が生じた時には、死傷者の身元特定に支障を来すのではないか、との指摘もある。
sen.e: It is pointed out that, in case many die or are seriously injured, for example, in an accident of a Shinkansen train being overturned, it would be difficult to identify those dead or seriously injured.

It is pointed out that, in case many die or are seriously injured, for example, in an accident where a Shinkansen train is overturned, it would be difficult to identify those dead or seriously injured.

It is pointed out that, in case many die or are seriously injured, for example, in an accident where a Shinkansen train is overturned, it would be difficult to identify those dead or seriously injured.

sen.j: もしそうなった場合、家族への連絡や事故の補償などで大きな問題となることが予想される。
sen.e: If such a situation happens, it is supposed that serious problems would be raised in informing the relatives concerned or in making compensation for the accident.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: If such a situation happens, it is supposed that serious problems would arise in informing the relatives concerned or in making compensations for the accident.
If such a situation happens, it is supposed that serious problems would arise in informing the relatives concerned or in making compensations for the accident.

sen.j: しかしながら、新幹線を運営する各鉄道会社はこの課題について踏み込んだ対策を採るまでには至っていない。
sen.e: However, each Shinkansen line-operating JR company has not taken any in-depth measure for this problems.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, no Shinkansen line-operating JR company has taken any in-depth measures for this problem.
However, no Shinkansen line-operating JR company has taken any in-depth measures for this problem.

sen.j: 20世紀末から世界的に増加しているテロリズムに対しても、新幹線は脆弱ではないか、との指摘もされている。
sen.e: It is also pointed out that the Shinkansen lines might be vulnerable to the terrorism increasing globally since towards the end of the 20th century.
It is also pointed out that the Shinkansen lines might be vulnerable to the terrorism increasing globally since the end of the 20th century.

sen.j: 現状では航空機のような搭乗時の手荷物検査がなく、その気になれば車内やプラットホームに、爆発物や刃物を容易に持ち込むことができるのも事実である。
sen.e: In the present situation, it is a fact that, with no check on hand-carrying baggage, as in the case on board an airplane, explosives and/or knives could easily be brought into train-cars or on the platforms.

In the present situation, it is a fact that, with no check on hand-carrying baggage, as in the case on board an airplane, explosives and/or knives could easily be brought into train-cars or on the platforms.

sen.j: また高架橋などの軌道設備には周囲から容易に接近できる箇所が多く、この面でもたやすくテロの対象となりうる。
sen.e: In addition, many of the railway-related facilities, such as elevated bridges, can easily be accessed and could be targets by terrorists.
In addition, many of the railway-related facilities, such as elevated bridges, can easily be accessed and could be targets by terrorists.
In addition, many of the railway-related facilities, such as elevated bridges, can easily be accessed and could be targets by terrorists.

sen.j: なお、東海道新幹線・山陽新幹線の最新式車両新幹線N700系電車はデッキに防犯カメラをとりつけている。
sen.e: A security camera has been installed in the deck of each N700 series Shinkansen train-car, the latest model of the Tokaido Shinkansen line and Sanyo Shinkansen line.
A security camera has been installed in the deck of each N700 series Shinkansen train-car, the latest model of the Tokaido Shinkansen line and Sanyo Shinkansen line.
A security camera has been installed in the deck of each N700 series Shinkansen train-car, the latest model of the Tokaido Shinkansen line and Sanyo Shinkansen line.

sen.j: しかし、ロンドン同時爆破事件の事例のごとく、防犯カメラを取り付けてもテロに対する抜本的な予防策にはならない。
sen.e: However, as in the case of the simultaneous blowing-up incident in London, installing security camera alone cannot be effective enough for preventing terrorism.
However, as in the case of the simultaneous explosives incident in London, installing security cameras alone cannot be effective for preventing terrorism.
However, as in the case of the simultaneous explosives incident in London, installing security cameras alone cannot be effective for preventing terrorism.

sen.j: また、防犯カメラの設置が「プライバシーの侵害につながらないか」と危惧する声もある。
sen.e: In addition, there are apprehensive voices that the installment of security camera might violate privacy.
In addition, there are apprehensive voices that the installment of security camera might violate privacy.
In addition, there are apprehensive voices that the installment of security camera might violate privacy.

sen.j: ちなみに、JR東日本の各新幹線では、テロ対策のため、車内のゴミ箱を一切利用停止にしていた時期があったが、乗客からの不便という声が高まり、現在は利用を再開している。
sen.e: By the way, JR East stopped use of the trash boxes on the train-cars in each of its shinkansen lines completely as a measure against terrorism for a while, but now, use of them has been resumed due to passengers' voices that such a measure gave them inconvenience.

By the way, JR East stopped the use of trash boxes on train-cars in each of its Shinkansen lines completely as a measure against terrorism for a while, but now, their use has been resumed due to passengers' voices that such a measure inconvenienced them.

sen.j: また、JR東海では「アメリカ同時多発テロ事件」以降、系列の警備会社と連携し、沿線を24時間体制で巡察している。
sen.e: After the Simultaneos Multiple Terrorism in the U.S. occurred, JR Tokai has patrolled the areas along the Shinkansen line for 24 hours a day in cooperation with a security company affiliated to it.
After Multiple Simultaneous Terrorism acts in the U.S. occurred, JR Tokai has patrolled the areas along the Shinkansen line, 24 hours a day, in cooperation with a security company affiliated to it.

sen.j: 2008年7月28日に東海道新幹線・山陽新幹線では、2008年12月より全編成において自動体外式除細動器（AED）を配備すると発表した。
sen.e: On July 28, 2008, the Tokaido Shinkansen line and Sanyo Shinkansen line announced that they would install an automated external defibrillator (AED) in each of its train-car organization starting in December of 2008.

tit.j: 新幹線の世界への影響
世界の高速鉄道の最高速度
tit.e: The maximum speeds of high-speed railway lines in the world
The maximum speeds of high-speed railway lines in the world
The maximum speeds of high-speed railway lines in the world

sen.j: 世界初の210km/h運転を達成した新幹線の成功は、欧米各国に影響を及ぼした。
sen.e: The world-first achivement of the successful 210-km/h Shinkansen operation affected nations in the world.
The world-first achievement of the successful 210-km/h Shinkansen operation affected nations of the world.
The world-first achievement of the successful 210-km/h Shinkansen operation affected nations of the Europe and America.

sen.j: 鉄道先進国を自負していたフランスは、1967年5月28日より高速列車フランス国鉄TGS気動車 をヨーロッパにおいて初めて200km/hで運転し、その後も複数の列車を200km/hで運行していた。
sen.e: In France having boasted of an advanced railway nation, high-speed TGS diesel train-cars of the natioal railways of France were operated at a speed of 200 km/h for the first time on May 28, 1967, and even after that, more than one train was operated at 200 km/h.

In France, having boasted an advanced railway nation, high-speed TGS diesel train-cars of the national railways of France were operated at a speed of 200 km/h for the first time on May 28, 1967, and even after that, more than one train was operated at 200 km/h.

In France, having boasted an advanced railway nation, high-speed TGS diesel train-cars of the national railways of France were operated at a speed of 200 km/h for the first time on May 28, 1967, and even after that, more than one train was operated at 200 km/h.

sen.j: 新幹線の開業後、1981年に本格的な超高速列車TGVを開発し、営業最高速度260km/hというスピード世界一の一覧を達成し、新幹線の記録を凌駕した。
sen.e: After starting the operation of a new trunk railway line, France developed full-scale super-high-speed TGV trains and achieved the world fastest speed in business operation of 260 km/s with the train, surpassing the record of the Shinkansen line

After starting operation of a new trunk railway line, France developed full-scale super-high-speed TGV trains and achieved the world fastest speed in business operation of 260 km/s with the train, surpassing the record of the Shinkansen line.

After starting operation of a new trunk railway line, France developed full-scale super-high-speed TGV trains in 1981 and achieved the world fastest speed in business operation of 260 km/s with the train, surpassing the record of the Shinkansen line.

sen.j: その他、ドイツ (ICE) やイタリア（ペンドリーノ）でも高速列車が計画され、実現に移された。
sen.e: In Germany (ICE) and Italy (Pendolino) as well, deveolpment of high-speed train systems were planned, being operated actually.
In Germany (ICE) and Italy (Pendolino) as well, development of high-speed train systems were planned and operated.
In Germany (ICE) and Italy (Pendolino) as well, development of high-speed train systems were planned and operated.

sen.j: イタリアのペンドリーノは欧州初の高速新線であり、1970年に工事が始まり、1978年に部分開業を迎え、1983年に250km/h運転を開始したものの、その後の整備で仏独に遅れを取り、全線が開業したのは1992年である。
sen.e: Pendolino in Italy, the Europe-first high-speed line, whose construction work had started in 1970, started a partial operation in 1978, started a 250-km/h operation in 1983, but fell behind Germany and France in later development efforts, with the operation of the entire planned line started as late as in 1992.

Pendolino in Italy, the Europe-first high-speed line, whose construction had started in 1970, started a partial operation in 1978, started a 250-km/h operation in 1983, but fell behind Germany and France in later development efforts, with the operation of the entire planned line starting as late as 1992.

sen.j: スペインは、高速新線の導入を検討していたが、TGV方式の高速列車を採用、その他にもフランスからTGVを導入する国が増えている。
sen.e: Spain, which also had investigated introduction of new high-speed railway lines, employed the TGV high-speed trains, and the number of nations introducing TGV from France has increased.

sen.j: ロシアの高速列車ソコル (列車)は1997年、ドイツ鉄道の技術支援を受け、モスクワ - サンクトペテルブルグ間654kmを営業時の最高速度250km/hで結んだことにより、それまで4時間20分掛かっていたものが、2時間30分に短縮された。
sen.e: Getting technical assistance from Germany, Russia connected in 1997 the distance of 654 km between Moscow and Saint Petersburg at a maximum operation speed of 250 km/h with Sokol trains, shortening the traveling time from four hours and 20 minutes to two hours and 30 minutes.

Getting technical assistance from Germany, Russia connected in 1997 the distance of 654 km between Moscow and Saint Petersburg at a maximum operation speed of 250 km/h with Sokol trains, shortening the traveling time from four hours and 20 minutes to two hours and 30 minutes.

sen.j: なお、既に標準軌の鉄道網が整備されているこれらの国では、駅周辺は従来の路線をそのまま使用し、郊外区間では諸条件によって高速新線建設と在来線改良を使い分けることが多い。
sen.e: In these nations where standard gauge railways had already been laid, the railways around stations were used as they had been, and in the sections far from the stations, new railways for high-speed operations were laid or existing railways were modified and used for high-speed operations.

sen.j: したがって、システム的には全線を新線として建設する新幹線とは別物と言える。
sen.e: Therefore, it can be said that, from the viewpoint of system, they are different from the Shinkansenn lines in which all railways have been laid newly.

sen.j: 走行試験を除く営業運転速度は、2008年10月現在、日本の新幹線はやて (列車)やドイツのICE3の技術を導入した中国北京・天津高速鉄道の350km/hが世界最高である。
sen.e: As of October of 2008, the fastest speed in business operation, except that in experimental running, is 350 km/h achieved by the Hayate train of Shinkansen in Japan and by Beijing–Tianjin Intercity Railway in China wherethe ICE3 technology of Germany has been introduced.

sen.j: フランスTGVの320km/h、JR西日本の500系 (300km/h)、ドイツが自国開発したICE (300km/h) がそれに続く。
sen.e: 320 km/h by TGV of France, 300 km/h by the 500 series trains of UR West, and 300 by ICE Germany developed for its own use follow.

sen.j: 大韓民国では2004年、フランスのTGV方式の韓国高速鉄道 (KTX) が300km/hで開業し、台湾では2007年、日本の新幹線方式（一部仏独の技術を導入）の台湾高速鉄道が300km/hで開業した。
sen.e: In Republic of Korea, Korea Train Express (KTX) started its operation at 300 km/h in 2004, employing the TGV system of France, and in Taiwan, Taiwan High Speed Rail started its operation at 300 km/h in 2004, employing the Shinkansen system in Japan (partially introducing technologies from France or Germany).

sen.j: TGVは360km/hへの速度向上を計画している。
sen.e: It planned to increase the speed of TGV to 360 km/h.

sen.j: 2007年後半からフランスのTGV方式のスペインのAVEは、マドリード - バルセロナ間630kmの新造線で、ドイツのICEの技術に使われているシーメンス製のVelaro Eという列車を使い350km/hで運転する計画がある。
sen.e: AVE in Spain, which has employed the TGV system in France since the latter half of 2007, plans to operate at 350 km/h the trains called Velaro E from Siemens that is used in technologies for ICE of Germany.

sen.j: それが実現すれば、マドリード - バルセロナ間は2時間30分に短縮される。
sen.e: When the operation is achieved, the traveling time between Madrid and Barcelona is shortened to two hours and 30 minutes.

sen.j: さらにロシアやベトナムでも新幹線をモデルにした最高速度350km/hの高速鉄道建設が計画されている。
sen.e: In addition, in Russia and Vietnam as well, it is planned to construct a maximum 350-km/h high-speed railway line with Shinkansen as its model.

sen.j: 浮上式鉄道を含めた2008年現在における世界最速の旅客営業鉄道路線は、2003年にドイツの技術によって開業した中国・上海浦東国際空港へのアクセス用に建設された上海トランスラピッドで、最高速度は430km/hである。
sen.e: As of 2008, the fastest passenger-carrying railway line, including levitated railways, is Shanghai Transrapid constructed in 2003 for accessing Shanghai Pudong International Airport, employing German technologies, and the maximum speed is 430 km/h.

sen.j: 走行試験も含めた鉄道における最高速度の世界一は、日本のジェイアール式マグレブが山梨リニア実験線で記録した581km/h。
sen.e: The fastest train speed in the world, including those in running tests, is 581 km/h recorded by JR maglev trains on the Yamanashi maglev test line.

sen.j: 浮上式鉄道を除くとフランスTGVの高速試験車V150編成が記録した574.8km/hである（日本の非浮上式鉄道の最高記録はJR東海の新幹線955形電車によって達成された443km/hで世界第2位）。
sen.e: Except levitated railways, the fstest speed recorded in the world is 574.8 km/h by the 150-V organization high-speed TGV trains of France (the fastest speed on non-levitated railways in Japan is 443 km/h recorded by 995-type Shinkansen trains, the second fastest record in the world).

sen.j: 東海道新幹線は建設時期が古く、カーブなどの線路状況が200km/h台の設計になっている。
sen.e: Since the Tokaido Shinkansen line was constructed earlier, the railway conditions, such as curves, are designed for 200 km/h to 299 km/h.

sen.j: より新しい山陽新幹線・東北新幹線などもフランスやドイツなどと比較すると山岳区間が多く、路線の起伏やカーブの設計などにおいて高速化を妨げる点が多い。
sen.e: Even in the later Sanyo Shinkansen and Tohoku Shinkansen line, the routes are rather mountaineous compared with those in France and Germany, being provided with many obstacles, such as undulations and curves, which have prevented high-speed designs.

sen.j: 特に後者は上越新幹線共々寒冷地の耐寒・耐雪装備が不可欠であり、重量的に不利である。
sen.e: In particular, in the latter Shinkansen line as well as the Joetsu Shinkansen line, provision of coldploof and snowploof equipment requiped for cold areas is inevitable, being disadvantageous in respect of weight.

sen.j: また沿線に住宅地が多いため、騒音への対策も必要となるなど、300km/h以上の運転には解決すべき課題が多い。
sen.e: In addition, many problems still remain unsolved to operate trains at speeds over 300 km/h: For example, measures against noise are necessary because many houses exist along the railway lines.

sen.j: しかしJR東海・西日本では2007年より山陽新幹線で新幹線500系電車と同じ最高速度300km/h、東海道新幹線でも従来の車両では255km/hまで減速する必要のあった半径2500mのカーブを、車体傾斜装置を搭載することで270km/hで通過できる新幹線N700系電車の導入を開始した。
sen.e: However, JR Tokai and JR East started introducing N700 series Shinkansen tran-cars, which enabled the maximum speed of 300 km/h on the Sanyo Shinkansen line, the same as that of 500 series Shinkansen tran-cars and, with a car-body tilting system equipped, also enabled the speed of 270 km/h in the 2500-m radius curve sections, where the speed had formerly to be descreased to 255 km/h.

However, JR Tokai and JR East started introducing N700 series Shinkansen train-cars, which enabled a maximum speed of 300 km/h on the Sanyo Shinkansen line, the same as that of 500 series Shinkansen train-cars and, with a car-body tilting system equipped, also enabled a speed of 270 km/h in the 2500-m radius curve sections, where the speed had to be decreased to 255 km/h in the past.

However, JR Tokai and JR East started introducing N700 series Shinkansen train-cars from 2007, which enabled a maximum speed of 300 km/h on the Sanyo Shinkansen line, the same as that of 500 series Shinkansen train-cars and, with a car-body tilting system equipped, also enabled a speed of 270 km/h in the 2500-m radius curve sections, where the speed had to be decreased to 255 km/h in the past.

sen.j: また、JR東日本は2004年から360km/h走行を前提とした試験車両（新幹線E954形電車・新幹線E955形電車）の開発を開始しており、2005年からはE954形、2006年からはE955形も走行試験を行っている。
sen.e: In addition, in 2004, JR East started developing experimental train-cars (E954 type Shinkansen train-cars and E955 type Shinkansen train-cars) assuming 360-km/h operations, and test run of E954 type cars started in 2005, followed by that of E955 type cars in 2006.

In addition, in 2004, JR East started developing experimental train-cars (E954 type Shinkansen train-cars and E955 type Shinkansen train-cars) assuming 360-km/h operations, and test runs of E954 type cars started in 2005, followed by that of E955 type cars in 2006.

In addition, in 2004, JR East started developing experimental train-cars (E954 type Shinkansen train-cars and E955 type Shinkansen train-cars) assuming 360-km/h operations, and test runs of E954 type cars started in 2005, followed by that of E955 type cars in 2006.

sen.j: 台湾の南港駅 - 高雄駅間のうち、台北駅 - 新左営駅の約340kmで運行中の高速鉄道路線（台湾高速鉄道）は、独仏連合との熾烈な受注競争の末、日本連合が最終的に逆転、受注に成功した。
sen.e: Of the high-speed railway line (Taiwan High Speed Rail) between the Nangang station and the Kaohsiung station, the 340-km section between the Taipei station and the Xinzuoying station is now in operation: For receiving the construction order, a federation from France and Germany and a federation in Japan fought furiously, and the federation in Japan reversed the situation and succeeded in receiving the order at last.

Of the high-speed railway line (Taiwan High Speed Rail) between the Nangang station and the Kaohsiung station, the 340-km section between Taipei station and Xinzuoying station is now in operation: For receiving the construction order, a federation from France and Germany and a federation in Japan fought furiously, and the federation in Japan reversed the situation and succeeded in receiving the order at last.

Of the high-speed railway line (Taiwan High Speed Rail) between the Nangang Station and the Kaohsiung Station, the 340-km section between Taipei Station and Xinzuoying Station is now in operation: For receiving the construction order, a federation from France and Germany and a federation in Japan fought furiously, and the federation in Japan reversed the situation and succeeded in receiving the order at last.

sen.j: この高速鉄道は新幹線のシステムを導入して建設されており、車両には新幹線700系電車をベースとした台湾高速鉄道700T型電車が用いられている。
sen.e: This high-speed railway line was constructed by intorducing the Shinkansen system, and 700T-type Taiwan High Speed Rail train-cars, based on 700 seris Shinkansen train-cars, are used.
This high-speed railway line was constructed by introducing the Shinkansen system, and 700T-type Taiwan High Speed Rail train-cars, based on 700 seris Shinkansen train-cars, are used.
This high-speed railway line was constructed by introducing the Shinkansen system, and 700T-type Taiwan High Speed Rail train-cars, based on 700 series Shinkansen train-cars, are used.

sen.j: 日本が受注した背景には、技術や安全性もさる事ながら、台湾は歴史的にも日本に対し親近感を持っている事、地理的に日本と類似した条件にある事、地震に備えるシステムが構築されている事などが挙げられるが、最終的には日本側が提示した資金面での優遇措置を加えた事が契約締結の決め手となった。
sen.e: As the reasons why Japan could successfully receive the order, the following ones are considered in addtion to the technology and saftey, but the final decisive factor for closing the controct was a financially favorable measure the Japan side offerred: Taiwan has intimate feeling for Japan historically, has geographical conditions similar to those in Japn, and the Japanese system was provided with measures against earthquakes.

As the reasons why Japan could successfully receive the order, the following ones are considered in addition to the technology and safety, but the final decisive factor for closing the contract was a financially favorable measure the Japan side offered: Taiwan has intimate feelings for Japan historically, has geographical conditions similar to those in Japan, and the Japanese system was provided with measures against earthquakes.

As the reasons why Japan could successfully receive the order, the following ones are considered in addition to the technology and safety, but the final decisive factor for closing the contract was a financially favorable measure the Japan side offered: Taiwan has intimate feelings for Japan historically, has geographical conditions similar to those in Japan, and the Japanese system was provided with measures against earthquakes.

sen.j: 当初は2005年10月の開業を目指して建設が進められたが、台湾高速鉄道のコンサルタント業務を欧州連合が先に受注していたため、施工方法やスケジュールの調整が難航。
sen.e: Initially, the contruction was in progress targeting at an operation start in October of 2005, but because the order of consultation work for Taiwan High Speed Rail was received by the fedration in Europe in advance, the fedaration in Japan met difficulties in adjustments of construction methods and schedules.

Initially, construction was started targeting at an operation start in October of 2005, but because the order of consultation work for the Taiwan High Speed Rail was received by the federation in Europe in advance, the federation in Japan met difficulties in adjustments of construction methods and schedules.

Initially, construction was started targeting at an operation start in October of 2005, but because the order of consultation work for the Taiwan High Speed Rail was received by the federation in Europe in advance, the federation in Japan met difficulties in adjustments of construction methods and schedules.

sen.j: また建設工事の一部区間を受注していた韓国の現代建設による路盤の手抜き工事が発覚するなど、各国企業の思惑が入り乱れた。
sen.e: Sloppy work in making railway beds by Hyundai Engineering & Construction Co., Ltd. in Republic of Korea, which received an order to construct some sections, was found, and in addition to this, intentions of the companies in nations concerned were in disarray.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sloppy work in making railway beds by Hyundai Engineering & Construction Co., Ltd. in the Republic of Korea, which received an order to construct some sections, was found, and in addition to this, intentions of the companies in nations concerned were in disarray.
