sen.j: このため、開業時期が徐々に遅れ、結局2007年1月5日に板橋駅 (台北県) - 左営間で仮開業し、全線は2007年3月に正式開業。
sen.e: Therefore, the date of operation start was delayed gradually, and on January 15, 2007 at last, the operation started provisionally between the Banqiao Station (Taipei County) and Zuoying, with operation in the entire line starting officially in March of 2007.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the start date for operation was delayed gradually, and on January 15, 2007, at last, operation started provisionally between Banqiao Station (Taipei County) and Zuoying, with operation in the entire line starting officially in March of 2007.

Therefore, the start date for operation was delayed gradually, and on January 15, 2007, at last, operation started provisionally between Banqiao Station (Taipei County) and Zuoying, with operation in the entire line starting officially in March of 2007.

sen.j: 現在、台北 - 南港間が建設中であり、左営 - 高雄駅間の着工は未定である。
sen.e: At present, construction work is under way in the section between Taipei and Nanko, but whether construction work between Zuoying and the Kaohsiung station will be started has not been decided.
At present, construction work is under way in the section between Taipei and Nanko, but whether construction work between Zuoying and the Kaohsiung station will be started has not been decided.
At present, construction work is under way in the section between Taipei and Nanko, but whether construction work between Zuoying and the Kaohsiung station will be started has not been decided.

sen.j: 尚、台湾高速鉄道の顧問には、日本における新幹線計画の実現に大きく貢献した島秀雄の次男島隆が就いている。
sen.e: By the way, Takashi SHIMA, the second son of Hideo SHIMA who greatly contributed to the implementation of the Shinkansen plan in Japan, assumes an adviser to Taiwan High Speed Rail
By the way, Takashi SHIMA, the second son of Hideo SHIMA who greatly contributed to the implementation of the Shinkansen plan in Japan, is an adviser to the Taiwan High Speed Rail.
By the way, Takashi SHIMA, the second son of Hideo SHIMA who greatly contributed to the implementation of the Shinkansen plan in Japan, is an adviser to the Taiwan High Speed Rail.

sen.j: 2009年からイギリスのロンドン - ケント州間を高速新線CTRL(HS1、旧名CTRL Channel Tunnel Rail Link) 経由で運行される高速列車 “Olympic Javelin” の専用車両クラス395電車として、日立製作所が29編成計174両を受注し、2007年8月から引き渡しが始まった。
sen.e: "Olympic Javelin," high-speed train-cars, are scheduled to be operated between London and Kent State via CTRL (or HS1; the former CTRL: Channel Tunnel Rail Link) in England starting in 2009: In this project, Hitachi, Ltd. received an order of 174 class-395 train-cars dedicated for the operation, 29 organizations in total, and started handing over the train-cars in August of 2007.

"Olympic Javelin," high-speed train-cars, are scheduled to be operated between London and Kent State via CTRL (or HS1; the former CTRL: Channel Tunnel Rail Link) in England starting in 2009: In this project, Hitachi, Ltd. received an order of 174 class-395 train-cars dedicated for operation, 29 organizations in total, and started handing over the train-cars in August of 2007.

"Olympic Javelin," high-speed train-cars, are scheduled to be operated between London and Kent State via CTRL (or HS1; the former CTRL: Channel Tunnel Rail Link) in England starting in 2009: In this project, Hitachi, Ltd. received an order of 174 class-395 train-cars dedicated for operation, 29 organizations in total, and started handing over the train-cars in August of 2007.

sen.j: 車両は香港上海銀行 Rail UKが保有し、サウスイースタン (鉄道)が列車の運行を担当する。
sen.e: The train-cars are owned by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited, Rail UK, and are operated by Southeastern (a railway company).
The train-cars are owned by the Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited, Rail UK, and are operated by Southeastern (a railway company).
The train-cars are owned by the Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited, Rail UK, and are operated by Southeastern (a railway company).

sen.j: UIC規格路線を走る初めての日本製高速鉄道車両であり、HS1上においてTGVベースのユーロスターと混在して運行される事となる。
sen.e: These are the first Japan-made train-cars running on a UIC specification railway line, and are operated mixed with TGV-based Eurostar train-cars on the HS1line.
These are the first Japan-made train-cars running on a UIC specification railway line, and are operated mixed with TGV-based Eurostar train-cars on the HS1line.
These are the first Japan-made train-cars running on a UIC specification railway line, and are operated mixed with TGV-based Eurostar train-cars on the HS1line.

sen.j: 営業最高速度は、HS1上で140マイル毎時 (225km/h)、在来線では70mph (112km/h) で、将来的には時速170mph (275km/h) を目指す。
sen.e: The maximum speed in business operation is 140 miles/(h (225 km/h) on the HS1 line, with 170-km/h (275-km/h) operations aimed at in the future.
The maximum speed in business operation is 140 miles/(h (225 km/h) on the HS1 line, with 170-mph (275-km/h) operations aimed at in the future.
The maximum speed in business operation is 140 miles/h (225 km/h) on the HS1 line and 70 miles/h (112 km/h) on existing railway lines, with 170-mph (275-km/h) operations aimed at in the future.

sen.j: 中華人民共和国は北京市 - 上海市間1,300kmの北京・上海間高速鉄道計画など、8路線合計7,000kmの旅客専用線（最高速度350km/h）をはじめ、中国全土に最高速度200 - 350km/hの高速鉄道網の建設を進めている。
sen.e: Including the 1,300-km Beijing-Shanghai High-Speed Line Project between Beijing City and Shanghai City, People's Republic of China has been constructing 200-km/n - 300 km/h high-speed railway networks throughout China in addition to total 7,000-km eight-route passenger-dedicated railway lines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Including the 1,300-km Beijing-Shanghai High-Speed Line Project between Beijing City and Shanghai City, the People's Republic of China has been constructing 200-km/n - 300 km/h high-speed railway networks throughout China in addition to a total of 7,000-km eight-route passenger-dedicated railway lines.

Including the 1,300-km Beijing-Shanghai High-Speed Line Project between Beijing City and Shanghai City, the People's Republic of China has been constructing 200-km/n - 300 km/h high-speed railway networks throughout China in addition to a total of 7,000-km eight-route passenger-dedicated railway lines.

sen.j: しかしながら、国産高速車両「中国国鉄DJJ2型電車」の開発で多くのトラブルに見舞われたこともあって、日本・フランス・ドイツ・カナダなどからの技術導入を図っている。
sen.e: However, because the development of "Type DJJ2 China National Railway train," China's own high-speed train-cars, met many troubles, China has introduced technologies form Japan, France, Germany and Canada.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because the development of "Type DJJ2 China National Railway trains," China's own high-speed train-cars, met many troubles, China has introduced technologies from Japan, France, Germany, and Canada.

However, because the development of 'Type DJJ2 China National Railway trains,' China's own high-speed train-cars, met many troubles, China has introduced technologies from Japan, France, Germany, and Canada.

sen.j: 2007年から主要都市間の在来線高速化 (200 - 250km/h) 用にスウェーデンのRegina (鉄道車両)（カナダ・ボンバルディア製）をベースにした中国高速鉄道CRH1型電車（CRHは“China Railway High-Speed”の略）、イタリアのペンドリーノETR600電車（フランス・アルストム製）をベースにした中国高速鉄道CRH5型電車と共にJR東日本の新幹線E2系電車（川崎重工業車両カンパニー製）をベースにした中国高速鉄道CRH2型電車「子弾頭」が、2008年の北京オリンピックに合わせ開業した北京 - 天津市間の北京・天津高速鉄道 (350km/h) にはCRH2型の旅客専用線仕様とドイツのICE（シーメンス製）をベースにした中国高速鉄道CRH3型電車が導入された。
sen.e: From 2007, for the high-speed train-cars (200 km/h to 250 km/h) on existing railway lines, CRH1-type train-cars (CRH is the abbreviation of "China Railway High-Speed"), based on Regina in Sweden (from Bombardier in Canada), CRH5-type train-cars, based on Pendolino ETR600 train cars in Italy (from Alsthom in France), and CRH2-type train-cars, "kodantou" (bullet), based on E2 Shinkansen train-cars (from Kawasaki Heavy Industries Rolling Stock Company), have been introduced, and then for Beijing–Tianjin Intercity Railway that stated operation between Beijing and Tianjin City at the timing of Beijing Olympic Games in 2008, CRH3-type train-cars, based on the CRH2-type passenger train-car specifications and on ICE in Germany (from Siemens), have been introduced.

From 2007, for the high-speed train-cars (200 km/h to 250 km/h) on existing railway lines, CRH1-type train-cars (CRH is the abbreviation of "China Railway High-Speed"), based on Regina in Sweden (from Bombardier in Canada), CRH5-type train-cars, based on Pendolino ETR600 train cars in Italy (from Alsthom in France), and CRH2-type train-cars, "kodantou" (bullet), based on E2 Shinkansen train-cars (from Kawasaki Heavy Industries Rolling Stock Company), have been introduced, and then for Beijing–Tianjin Intercity Railway that stated operation between Beijing and Tianjin City for the Beijing Olympic Games in 2008, CRH3-type train-cars, based on the CRH2-type passenger train-car specifications and on ICE in Germany (from Siemens), have been introduced.

tit.j: 新幹線による貨物輸送

sen.j: いわゆる「貨物新幹線」は、東海道新幹線の建設時から構想だけは存在したものの（旅客列車のない深夜に超高速コンテナ電車を走らせる構想があった）、いまだに実現されていない。
sen.e: The idea of so-called "cargo Shinkansen" existed even when the construction of the Tokaido Shinkansen started (the operation of container trains at a super-high speed in the midnight), but has not been realized.

The idea of so-called "cargo Shinkansen" existed even when the construction of the Tokaido Shinkansen started (the operation of container trains at a super-high speed in the middle of the night), but has not been realized.

The idea of so-called 'cargo Shinkansen' existed even when the construction of the Tokaido Shinkansen started (the operation of container trains at a super-high speed in the middle of the night), but has not been realized.

sen.j: 新幹線による貨物輸送は、最高速度や制動距離などの違いからダイヤグラム上で旅客列車と混在させることは現状では困難である。
sen.e: At present, it is difficult to operate cargo trains and passenger trains mixed in a train schedule, because of differences in the maximum speeds and in the braking distances

sen.j: また、高速で走ったとしても積み替え等の時間が必要なことから、時間短縮効果が旅客ほど出てこないともされる。
sen.e: It is also said that, because it takes a considerable time to load and unload cargoes even if the train runs at a high speed, the effect of shortening transportation time is less, compared with passenger trains

sen.e: By the way, in 40 years, cargo trains with the similar concept have been introduced as "200 series JR cargo trains (super-rail cargo)."

sen.j: 東海道新幹線建設時の計画は、実際のところは世界銀行からの新幹線建設の資金調達のため、旅客だけでなく貨物輸送もあるというポーズをつけるための、ダミー構想といえるものであった。
sen.e: It can be said that, to obtain a fund from World Bank, the plan of constructing the Tokai Shinkansen line was actually a story fabricated to pose that the line would be used for transporting not only passengers but also cargoes.

It can be said that, to obtain a fund from the World Bank, construction plans for the Tokai Shinkansen line was actually a story fabricated to pose that the line would be used for transporting not only passengers but also cargo.

It can be said that, to obtain a fund from the World Bank, construction plans for the Tokaido Shinkansen line was actually a story fabricated to pose that the line would be used for transporting not only passengers but also cargo.

sen.j: 当時の欧米は鉄道斜陽論が台頭していた上、世界銀行のあるアメリカ合衆国では、すでに鉄道は旅客利用ではなく貨物が中心となっていた。
sen.e: In Europe and the US at that time, the theory that the railway lines are destined to decline began appearing, and in addition, in the US where World Bank was located, the railway lines had been not for passengers but mostly for cargoes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Europe and the US at that time, the theory that the railway lines are destined to decline began appearing, and in addition, in the US where the World Bank was located, the railway lines had not been for passengers, but mostly for cargo.

sen.j: このため、「旅客専用」の新しい鉄道建設を理解してくれないだろうから、建設資金を貸し出さないだろうと考えていた。
sen.e: Therefore, it was considered that the bank would not understand that new railway lines "dedicated for passengers" should be constructed and would not lend money for the construction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it was considered that the bank would not understand that new railway lines "dedicated for passengers" should be constructed and would not lend money for the construction.

sen.j: しかし、新幹線には、割引料金に対する予約変更の優位性、発車場所へのアクセス性、前後のアクセスにJR線を利用する場合に運賃通算が可能、本数（輸送力）の多さと定時性、手荷物検査や持込品目の制限などの煩雑さがない優位性がある。
sen.e: However, Shinkansen has the following superiorities: it is allowed to change discount tickets, access to departure places is easier, a through fare is applied when a JR line is used connectedly, lots of trains are available and operated as scheduled, and no cumbersome procedure of baggage checks is necessary nor restriction on things to be brought on board is imposed.

sen.j: 航空会社との対抗については、航空路線と競合する区間を中心に割引率の大きい特別企画乗車券の発売や、ビジネス客の多い東海道・山陽新幹線ではJR東海エクスプレス・カードとJ-WESTカード（エクスプレス）による「エクスプレス予約」、東北や上越・長野新幹線では「えきねっと」といった、運行会社自身の会員制インターネット予約による割引特急券の発売が行われている。
sen.e: To compete with airline companies, the following efforts have been made: Specially planned tickets offering large discount rates are sold centered on the sections in competition with airline routes, "Express reservations" with a JR Tokai express card and J-WEST card (Express) are offered in the Tokaido line and Sanyo Shinkanken line that are used by many business customers, and in the Tohoku, Joetsu and Nagano Shinkansen lines, discount limited-express tickets are sold on an Internet reservation basis for the members of the operating company.

sen.e: Therefore, JR Tokai and JR West, having frequently been confronted with each other, have become to cooperate more strongly: For examples, the coverage of the "Express reservation" has been expanded to the Sanyo Shinkansen line, and N700 series train-cars, the next generation train-cars aiming at a high performance of 300-km/h operations and at the passenger comfortableness exceeding that of 700 series train-cars, have been developed jointly.

sen.j: 神戸駅 (兵庫県)以東のJR神戸線およびJR京都線の各駅から岡山・広島方面へ向かう場合は、新大阪駅または新神戸駅で山陽新幹線に乗り換えるよりも、大阪・三ノ宮駅で特急スーパーはくと号に乗車して姫路で山陽新幹線に乗り換える方が料金的に有利であるケースが多い。
sen.e: When going to the Okayama or Hiroshima area from a station on the JR Kobe line or on JR Kyoto line to the east of the Kobe station (located in Hyogo Prefecture), it is advantageous in many cases to ride on Limited Express Super Hakuto at the Osaka station or Sannomiya station and then to ride on a train on the Sanyo Shinkansen line at Hymenia, rather than riding on a train on the Sanyo Shinkansen line at the Shin-Osaka or Shin-Kobe station.

sen.j: 加えて神戸駅以東のJR神戸線各駅からは時間的にも有利であるケースが多い。
sen.e: In addition, taking such routes, from each station on the JR Kobe line to the east of the Kobe station, is also advantageous in the traveling time as well in many cases.

sen.j: 高速バス昼行の長距離では、たとえ格安であっても新幹線の速度と定時性にはかなわないものがある。
sen.e: Daytime long-distance operations of express buses cannot compete with Shinkansen in the speeds and in the punctual operations, even though the fares are considerably cheaper.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Daytime long-distance operations of express buses cannot compete with Shinkansen in speed and in punctual operations, even though the fares are considerably cheaper.
Daytime long-distance operations of express buses cannot compete with Shinkansen in speed and in punctual operations, even though the fares are considerably cheaper.

sen.j: しかしながら、既出の例を含む中距離区間や、新幹線が中心とされた東京・大阪間を初めとする区間を夜行バスで寝ている間に格安で移動できるということで、1980年代ごろから人気が出てきている。
sen.e: However, express buses for middle-distance sections described above, and mid-night express buses for various sections, including that between Tokyo and Osaka, on which you can reach your destination while sleeping, have gained popularity since around 1980s.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 国鉄の名残からJR新幹線沿線をJRバスが運行する路線もある（東京-名古屋・京阪神間が中心）。
sen.e: Being reminiscent of the JNR era, the JR bus company as well operates some routes along JR Shinkansen lines (centered between Tokyo and Nagoya/the Keihanshin area).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Being reminiscent of the JNR era, the JR bus company as well operates some routes along JR Shinkansen lines (centered between Tokyo and Nagoya/Keihanshin area).
Being reminiscent of the JNR era, the JR bus company as well operates some routes along JR Shinkansen lines (centered between Tokyo and Nagoya/Keihanshin area).

sen.j: しかしながら、JRグループ以外の競合会社（私鉄・専業系路線バスのほか、貸切バスによる会員制ツアーバスもある）の進出も急増し、各JR新幹線と実質競合している。
sen.e: However, many companies other than those belonging to the JR group (bus-operating companies owned by private railway line companies, companies specialized in route bus operations, and chartered membership-based tour buses as well) have entered this business in a short period of time, generating competitive situations with each Shinkansen line.

However, many companies other than those belonging to the JR group (bus-operating companies owned by private railway line companies, companies specialized in route bus operations, and chartered membership-based tour buses as well) have entered this business in a short period of time, generating competitive situations with Shinkansen lines.

sen.j: 高速バスは、バスの特性を生かして都市の市街地（東京の新宿や渋谷、名古屋の栄 (名古屋市)、大阪の梅田や難波、広島の紙屋町・八丁堀、福岡の天神 (福岡市)など）やテーマパーク（東京ディズニーリゾートやユニバーサルスタジオジャパンなど）に直接乗り入れるなどしている。
sen.e: Being a bus, an express bus brings you directly to a central area of a city (for examples, Shinjuku or Shibuya of Tokyo, Sakae of Nagoya (in Nagoya City), Umeda or Nanba of Osaka, Kamiyacho or Hacchobori of Hiroshima, or Tenjin of Fukuoka (in Fukuoka City, etc)) or to a theme park (Tokyo Disney Resort, Universal Studios Japan, etc).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: このため、新幹線の駅を結ぶ競合でなくても新幹線の客を奪っているのである（ただ、運賃と所要時間が違いすぎるため、直接的な新幹線との競合というよりは、利用客のニーズの違いで使い分けられている感が大きい）。
sen.e: Therefore, these buses do not constitute competitions with Shinkansen lines for routes connecting stations on Shinkansen lines, but indirectly get customers who could use Shinkansen lines (However, because there are too much differences between their fares and between the traveling times, it can be said that the trains or buses are selectively used based on customers' needs, rather than they compete with each other directly).

sen.j: なおJR新幹線は協定により深夜・早朝の運転を行わない。
sen.e: By the way, according to an agreement, JR Shinkansen lines do not operate trains in mid-night and early in the morning.
By the way, according to an agreement, JR Shinkansen lines do not operate trains in the middle of the night and early in the morning.

sen.j: 新幹線の建設に関しては、その開業効果が大きいことから沿線の利害に関係することとして、建設時より様々な政治介入がなされてきたといわれる。
sen.e: Concerning the construction of Shinkansen lines, it is said that various political interventions were exerted starting at constructing them, because their operation starts significantly affect interests of the areas along these lines.

Concerning the construction of Shinkansen lines, it is said that various political interventions were exerted when construction started, because the start of their operation significantly affects interests of the areas along these lines.

Concerning the construction of Shinkansen lines, it is said that various political interventions were exerted when construction started, because the start of their operation significantly affects interests of the areas along these lines.

sen.j: 最も古い話では、東海道新幹線の建設時に起こった、京都駅の設置是非をめぐる問題や、大野伴睦の介入による岐阜羽島駅の設置騒動がある（ただし、岐阜羽島駅の設置には関ヶ原の降雪対策という、政治的な影響力とは別の理由もあり、政治力のみで設置されたわけではないと言われている）。
sen.e: The oldest examples include the problem about whether the Kyoto station should be placed or not, and the dispute about the placement of the Gifu-Hajima station due to an intervention by Bamboku ONO (however, it is said that the Gifu-Hajima station has been placed as a measure for snow fall in the Sekigahara area as well, apart from political influence, and has not been placed solely by political power).

The oldest examples include the problem about whether Kyoto station should be placed or not, and the dispute about the placement of the Gifu-Hajima station due to an intervention by Bamboku ONO (however, it is said that the Gifu-Hajima station has been placed as a measure for snow fall in the Sekigahara area as well, apart from political influence, and has not been placed solely by political power).

The oldest examples include the problem about whether Kyoto Station should be placed or not when the Tokaido Shinkansen line was constructed, and the dispute about the placement of the Gifu-Hajima Station due to an intervention by Banboku ONO (however, it is said that the Gifu-Hajima Station has been placed as a measure for snow fall in the Sekigahara area as well, apart from political influence, and has not been placed solely by political power).

sen.j: また逆に、一度は着工された駅新設が、その新設を争点とした選挙での県知事交代によって凍結に追い込まれた滋賀県の南びわ湖駅の例もある。
sen.e: An opposite example also exists: The work to construct the Minami-Biwako station in Shiga Prefecture had been started, but was stopped by the new governor who won an election by advocating the stop of the construction work.

tit.j: 世界の高速鉄道の呼称
tit.e: Names of high-speed railway lines in the world
Names of high-speed railway lines of the world
Names of high-speed railway lines of the world

sen.j: 日本では、新幹線という単語が既に高速鉄道そのものを意味する普通名詞と化している。
sen.e: In Japan, the term of Shinkansen itself has already become a common noun indicating a high-speed railway line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Japan, the term of Shinkansen itself has already become a common noun indicating a high-speed railway line.
In Japan, the term of Shinkansen itself has already become a common noun indicating a high-speed railway line.

sen.j: そのため、報道などでは日本国外の高速鉄道についても国名を付けて「○○新幹線」「○○版新幹線」「○○の新幹線」と広く呼ばれている（例：TGVはフランス新幹線、ICEはドイツ新幹線、韓国高速鉄道は韓国新幹線、ソ連運輸省ЭР200型電車はロシア新幹線、台湾高速鉄道は台湾新幹線など）。
sen.e: Therefore, for a high-speed railway line in a country other than Japan, expressions of "XX Shinkansen," XX-version Shinkansen," or "XX-no Shinkansen" (Shinkansen in XX) (where XX indicates a nation name) are used, for examples, in news reports (for examples: "TGV is the French Shinkansen," "ICE is the German Shinkansen," "Korea Train Express (KTX) is Korean Shinkansen," "Soviet ЭР200 electric trains are Russian Shinkansen," or "Taiwan High Speed Rail is Taiwanese Shinkansen).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, for a high-speed railway line in a country other than Japan, expressions of "XX Shinkansen," XX-version Shinkansen," or "XX-no Shinkansen" (Shinkansen in XX) (where XX indicates a nation name) are used, for example, in news reports ("TGV is the French Shinkansen," "ICE is the German Shinkansen," "Korea Train Express (KTX) is the Korean Shinkansen," "Soviet ЭР200 electric trains are the Russian Shinkansen," or "Taiwan High Speed Rail is the Taiwanese Shinkansen).

Therefore, for a high-speed railway line in a country other than Japan, expressions of 'XX Shinkansen,' 'XX-version Shinkansen,' or 'XX-no Shinkansen' (Shinkansen in XX) (where XX indicates a nation name) are used, for example, in news reports ('TGV is the French Shinkansen,' 'ICE is the German Shinkansen,' 'Korea Train Express (KTX) is the Korean Shinkansen,' 'Soviet ЭР200 electric trains are the Russian Shinkansen,' or 'Taiwan High Speed Rail is the Taiwanese Shinkansen).

sen.j: しかし、日本の新幹線は鉄道車両、軌道 (鉄道)、架線、信号 (ATC) などを総合した独自のシステムであり、ミニ新幹線を除けばヨーロッパのように在来線と相互乗り入れしているわけではない。
sen.e: However, Shinkansen in Japan is an independent system integrating train-cars, railways, aerial power supply lines, and signals (ATC), and the trains are not operated through regular railway lines as those in Europe, except those on the Mini-Shinkansen lines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処信号保安(自動列車制御装置)： ウェブ上の” 信号 (ATC)”に置き換えてあります。
sen.e: However, Shinkansen in Japan is an independent system integrating train-cars, railways, aerial power supply lines, and signals (ATC), and the trains are not operated through regular railway lines as those in Europe, except those on the Mini-Shinkansen lines.

However, Shinkansen in Japan is an independent system integrating train-cars, railways, aerial power supply lines, and signals (ATC), and the trains are not operated through regular railway lines as those in Europe, except those on the Mini-Shinkansen lines.

sen.j: そのため、他の高速鉄道システムとは区別することがある。
sen.e: Therefore, Shinkansen is sometimes differentiated from other high-speed railway systems.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Shinkansen is sometimes differentiated from other high-speed railway systems.
Therefore, Shinkansen is sometimes differentiated from other high-speed railway systems.

sen.j: 英語では、日本の新幹線はenshinkansenと表記される様に、新幹線とは日本の高速鉄道システムの固有の名称として取り扱っている。
sen.e: In English, Shinkansen in Japan is expressed as Shinkansen, handled as a proper noun indicating High-speed railway line systems in Japan

sen.e: In English, Shinkansen in Japan is expressed as Shinkansen, handled as a proper noun indicating High-speed railway line systems in Japan.
In English, Shinkansen in Japan is expressed as Shinkansen, handled as a proper noun indicating High-speed railway line systems in Japan.

sen.j: 技術的には、他国の高速鉄道と異なり在来線とは独立したシステムとなっているのが特徴で、動力分散方式など独自性が強いのも特徴である。
sen.e: Technically, constituting a system independent of regular railway lines is one of the features of Shinkansen to be differentiated from high-speed railway lines in other countries, and another feature is its uniqueness, for example, employing the distributed traction system

tit.j: 駅での新幹線案内表示

sen.j: 新幹線の乗り入れる駅において、駅構内の表示では、ピクトグラムとして国鉄時代は新幹線0系電車・新幹線200系電車を元にした絵（丸型の先頭車両）が描かれていた。
sen.e: At the stations where Shinkansen trains stopped, a picture based on the 0 series Shinkansen train-car or 200 series Shinkansen train-car (the round-shaped head train-car) was drawn as a pictogram in the era of JNR, as displays in their premises.

sen.j: JR東日本の東北・上越新幹線の駅、及び東京駅での東海道新幹線乗り場案内サイン（JR東日本構内）は現在もこれを踏襲している。
sen.e: Even today, this pictogram is used at the stations on the Tohoku Shinkansen line and Joetsu Shinkansen line, and for the displays showing the gates to the Tokaido Shinkansen line at the Tokyo station (in the premises of JR East).

sen.j: 地下鉄など国鉄・JR以外の駅では、乗り換え表示に「JR線」と表示するのではなく「JR線・新幹線」と新幹線を在来線と分けて記載する例がみられる。

sen.j: 新幹線の「音」は「ビュワーン」という擬音表現が古くからよく知られ、メディアなどでも取り上げられることが多かった（新幹線を用いた旅行という設定のCM、後述する『はしれちょうとっきゅう』の歌詞など）。
sen.e: As "sound" of Shinkansen trains, the onomatopoeic expression of "byuwaan" was used from the early days, and was often taken up by media as well (used in commercials for travels using Shikansen, and included in the song of "Hashire-hashire chotokkyu" (Go, go, super express).

sen.j: これを新幹線の走行音と思う人も多かったが、実際は走行中（主に高速走行時）の警笛音である。
sen.e: Many thought that this was the running sound of Shinkansen trains, but actually the warning horn.

sen.j: なお、この音で新幹線がイメージされることは、1980年代以降薄れた。
sen.e: By the way, this sound has gradually ceased to recall Shinkansen since 1980s.
By the way, this sound has gradually ceased to bring up images of Shinkansen since the 1980s.

sen.j: また、新幹線100系電車以降の東海道・山陽新幹線車両や東海道・山陽新幹線以外の新幹線については、この音をメディアなどで取り上げられることはなかった。
sen.e: For the train-cars that were introduced to the Tokaido Shinkansen line and Sanyo Shinkansen line following 100 series Shinkansen train-cars, and for those of the Shinkansen lines other than the Tokaido Shinkansen line and Sanyo Shinkansen line, this sound has never taken up by media.

sen.j: 実際の新幹線の走行音は、低速運転時（少なくとも110km/h以下）の場合は在来線の走行音より静かである。
sen.e: The actual level of the running sound of Shinkansen trains is smaller than that of those on regular railway lines in low-speed operations (at least at 110 km/h or less).
The actual level of the running sound of Shinkansen trains is smaller than that of those on regular railway lines in low-speed operations (at least at 110 km/h or less).
The actual level of the running sound of Shinkansen trains is smaller than that of those on regular railway lines in low-speed operations (at least at 110 km/h or less).

sen.j: 走行音の発生源としては車輪や架線、車体前面や側面・上面の突起物による風切り音（空力音）がある。
sen.e: The running sound sources of Shinkansen trains are those from the wheels, those from the aerial power lines, and the sound of wind generated by protrusions in front of and on the sides of the fast-moving train-car bodies (aerodynamic sound).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The running sound sources of Shinkansen trains are those from the wheels, those from the aerial power lines, and the sound of wind generated by protrusions in front of and on the sides of the fast-moving train-car bodies (aerodynamic sound).

The running sound sources of Shinkansen trains are those from the wheels, those from the aerial power lines, and the sound of wind generated by protrusions in front of and on the sides of the fast-moving train-car bodies (aerodynamic sound).

sen.j: しかしながら、300km/h近くなると空力音がその大半を占めるようになる。
sen.e: However, most of the sound becomes the aerodynamic sound, when the speed becomes near to 300 km/h.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, most of the sound becomes aerodynamic sound, when the speed approaches 300 km/h.
However, most of the sound becomes aerodynamic sound, when the speed approaches 300 km/h.

sen.j: そのため高速走行には「新幹線車両」で述べたような空力音対策が必要とされる。
sen.e: Therefore, taking measures against the aerodynamic sound becomes necessary for operating trains at high speeds, as described in the section of "Train-cars for the slinkiness lines."
Therefore, taking measures against the aerodynamic sound becomes necessary for operating trains at high speeds, as described in the section of "Train-cars for the Shinkansen lines."
Therefore, taking measures against the aerodynamic sound becomes necessary for operating trains at high speeds, as described in the section of 'Train-cars for the Shinkansen lines.'

sen.j: トンネル突入の際、圧縮された空気により、退出側の坑口周辺で凄まじい騒音が発生する。
sen.e: When a Shinkansen train enters a tunnel, a tremendously large noise is generated at the exit side of the tunnel due to the compressed air.
When a Shinkansen train enters a tunnel, a tremendously large noise is generated at the exit side of the tunnel due to the compressed air.
When a Shinkansen train enters a tunnel, a tremendously large noise is generated at the exit side of the tunnel due to the compressed air.

sen.j: トンネル微気圧波による騒音であり、圧縮波とも呼ばれている。
sen.e: This is the noise generated by air-pressure wave, and is also called a compressed wave.
This is the noise generated by air-pressure waves, and is also called a compressed wave.
This is the noise generated by air-pressure waves, and is also called a compressed wave.

sen.j: 上記に同じく、対策が必要とされる。
sen.e: Against this as well, taking some measures is required.
Against this as well, taking some measures is required.
Against this as well, taking some measures is required.

sen.j: 静岡県田方郡函南町には「新幹線」という地名が存在する。
sen.e: A place named "Shinkansen" exists in Kannami Town, Takada County, Shizuoka Prefecture.
A place named "Shinkansen" exists in Kannami Town, Takada County, Shizuoka Prefecture.
A place named 'Shinkansen' exists in Kannami Town, Takada-gun, Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: これは戦後の新幹線計画からの地名でなく、戦前の弾丸列車計画時代に丹那トンネルの工事を行うための従業員宿舎が置かれた場所である。
sen.e: This name was not given based on the Shinkansen plan after the war, but the place was the site where lodgings for workers engaged in the construction of the Tanna tunnel was located in the pre-war era of the bullet train plan.

This name was not given based on the Shinkansen plan after the war, but the place was the site where lodgings for workers engaged in the construction of the Tanna tunnel in the pre-war era of the bullet train plan.

This name was not given based on the Shinkansen plan after the war, but the place was the site where lodgings for workers engaged in the construction of the Tanna tunnel in the pre-war era of the bullet train plan.

sen.j: 工事終了後に宿舎は撤去された。
sen.e: After the work was completed, the lodgings were removed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the work was completed, the lodgings were removed.
After the work was completed, the lodgings were removed.

sen.j: しかしながら、その後同地に住宅団地が建てられ「新幹線」という地区が生まれる事となった。
sen.e: However, later, a housing development was built at the site, and the district was named "Shinkansen."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, later, a housing development was built at the site, and the district was named "Shinkansen."
However, later, a housing development was built at the site, and the district was named 'Shinkansen.'

sen.j: この地区には新幹線公民館や「幹線下」という名のバス停留所も存在している。
sen.e: In this district, a community center named "Shinkansen" and a bus stop named "Kansen-shita" exist as well.
In this district, a community center named "Shinkansen" and a bus stop named "Kansen-shita" exist as well.
In this district, a community center named 'Shinkansen' and a bus stop named 'Kansen-shita' exist as well.

sen.j: また、東京都国分寺市の鉄道総合技術研究所のある場所の地名は「光町」である。
sen.e: The site in Kokubunji City, Tokyo, where Railway Technical Research Institute is located is named "Hikari-cho."
The site in Kokubunji City, Tokyo, where the Railway Technical Research Institute is located is named "Hikari-cho."
The site in Kokubunji City, Tokyo, where the Railway Technical Research Institute is located is named 'Hikari-cho.'

sen.j: 新幹線開発を記念し、東海道新幹線の列車愛称「ひかり」から付けられたという。
sen.e: It is said that this name was given after "Hikari," a nickname for trains on the Tokaido Shinkansen line, commemorating the development of Shinkansen.
